verses.name: Hermas: Book III 1:1
verses.text: The Pastor  Book Third.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 1:2
verses.text: —Similitudes.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 1:3
verses.text: Similitude First.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 1:4
verses.text: As in This World We Have No Abiding City, We Ought to Seek One to Come.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 1:5
verses.text: He says to me, "You know that you who are the servants of God dwell in a strange land; for your city is far away from this one.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 1:6
verses.text: If, then," he continues, "you know your city in which you are to dwell, why do ye here provide lands, and make expensive preparations, and accumulate dwellings and useless buildings? He who makes such preparations for this city cannot return again to his own.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 1:7
verses.text: Oh foolish, and unstable, and miserable man! Dost thou not understand that all these things belong to another, and are under the power of another? for the lord of this city will say, 'I do not wish thee to dwell in my city; but depart from this city, because thou obeyest not my laws.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 1:8
verses.text: ' Thou, therefore, although having fields and houses, and many other things, when cast out by him, what wilt thou do with thy land, and house, and other possessions which thou hast gathered to thyself? For the lord of this country justly says to thee, 'Either obey my laws or depart from my dominion.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 1:9
verses.text: ' What, then, dost thou intend to do, having a law in thine own city, on account of thy lands, and the rest of thy possessions? Thou shalt altogether deny thy law, and walk according to the law of this city.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 1:10
verses.text: See lest it be to thy hurt to deny thy law; for if thou shalt desire to return to thy city, thou wilt not be received, because thou hast denied the law of thy city, but wilt be excluded from it.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 1:11
verses.text: Have a care, therefore: as one living in a foreign land, make no further preparations for thyself than such merely as may be sufficient; and be ready, when the master of this city shall come to cast thee out for disobeying his law, to leave his city, and to depart to thine own, and to obey thine own law without being exposed to annoyance, but in great joy.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 1:12
verses.text: Have a care, then, ye who serve the Lord, and have Him in your heart, that ye work the works of God, remembering His commandments and promises which He promised, and believe that He will bring them to pass if His commandments be observed.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 1:13
verses.text: Instead of lands, therefore, buy afflicted souls, according as each one is able, and visit widows and orphans, and do not overlook them; and spend your wealth and all your preparations, which ye received from the Lord, upon such lands and houses.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 1:14
verses.text: For to this end did the Master make you rich, that you might perform these services unto Him; and it is much better to purchase such lands, and possessions, and houses, as you will find in your own city, when you come to reside in it.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 1:15
verses.text: This is a noble and sacred expenditure, attended neither with sorrow nor fear, but with joy.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 1:16
verses.text: Do not practice the expenditure of the heathen, for it is injurious to you who are the servants of God; but practice an expenditure of your own, in which ye can rejoice; and do not corrupt nor touch what is another's nor covet it, for it is an evil thing to covet the goods of other men; but work thine own work, and thou wilt be saved".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 1:17
verses.text: Similitude Second.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 1:18
verses.text: As the Vine is Supported by the Elm, So is the Rich Man Helped by the Prayer of the Poor.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 1:19
verses.text: As I was walking in the field, and observing an elm and vine, and determining in my own mind respecting them and their fruits, the Shepherd appears to me, and says, "What is it that you are thinking about the elm and vine?" "I am considering," I reply, "that they become each other exceedingly well".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 1:20
verses.text: "These two trees," he continues, "are intended as an example for the servants of God".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 1:21
verses.text: "I would like to know," said I, "the example which these trees you say, are intended to teach".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 1:22
verses.text: "Do you see," he says, "the elm and the vine?" "I see them sir," I replied.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 1:23
verses.text: "This vine," he continued, "produces fruit, and the elm is an unfruitful tree; but unless the vine be trained upon the elm, it cannot bear much fruit when extended at length upon the ground; and the fruit which it does bear is rotten, because the plant is not suspended upon the elm.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 1:24
verses.text: When, therefore, the vine is cast upon the elm, it yields fruit both from itself and from the elm.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 1:25
verses.text: You see, moreover, that the elm also produces much fruit, not less than the vine, but even more; because," he continued, "the vine, when suspended upon the elm, yields much fruit, and good; but when thrown upon the ground, what it produces is small and rotten.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 1:26
verses.text: This similitude, therefore, is for the servants of God—for the poor man and for the rich".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 1:27
verses.text: "How so, sir?" said I; "explain the matter to me".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 1:28
verses.text: "Listen," he said: "The rich man has much wealth, but is poor in matters relating to the Lord, because he is distracted about his riches; and he offers very few confessions and intercessions to the Lord, and those which he does offer are small and weak, and have no power above.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 1:29
verses.text: But when the rich man refreshes the poor, and assists him in his necessities, believing that what he does to the poor man will be able to find its reward with God—because the poor man is rich in intercession and confession, and his intercession has great power with God—then the rich man helps the poor in all things without hesitation; and the poor man, being helped by the rich, intercedes for him, giving thanks to God for him who bestows gifts upon him.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 1:30
verses.text: And he still continues to interest himself zealously for the poor man, that his wants may be constantly supplied.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 1:31
verses.text: For he knows that the intercession of the poor man is acceptable and influential with God.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 1:32
verses.text: Both, accordingly, accomplish their work.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 1:33
verses.text: The poor man makes intercession; a work in which he is rich, which he received from the Lord, and with which he recompenses the master who helps him.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 1:34
verses.text: And the rich man, in like manner, unhesitatingly bestows upon the poor man the riches which he received from the Lord.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 1:35
verses.text: And this is a great work, and acceptable before God, because he understands the object of his wealth, and has given to the poor of the gifts of the Lord, and rightly discharged his service to Him.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 1:36
verses.text: Among men, however, the elm appears not to produce fruit, and they do not know nor understand that if a drought come, the elm, which contains water, nourishes the vine; and the vine, having an unfailing supply of water, yields double fruit both for itself and for the elm.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 1:37
verses.text: So also poor men interceding with the Lord on behalf of the rich, increase their riches; and the rich, again, aiding the poor in their necessities, satisfy their souls.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 1:38
verses.text: Both, therefore, are partners in the righteous work.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 1:39
verses.text: He who does these things shall not be deserted by God, but shall be enrolled in the books of the living.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 1:40
verses.text: Blessed are they who have riches, and who understand that they are from the Lord.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 1:41
verses.text: For they who are of that mind will be able to do some good".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 1:42
verses.text: Similitude Third.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 1:43
verses.text: As in Winter Green Trees Cannot Be Distinguished from Withered, So in This World Neither Can the Just from the Unjust.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 1:44
verses.text: He showed me many trees having no leaves, but withered, as it seemed to me; for all were alike.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 1:45
verses.text: And he said to me, "Do you see those trees?" "I see, sir," I replied, "that all are alike, and withered".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 1:46
verses.text: He answered me, and said, "These trees which you see are those who dwell in this world".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 1:47
verses.text: "Why, then, sir," I said, "are they withered, as it were, and alike?" "Because," he said, "neither are the righteous manifest in this life, nor sinners, but they are alike; for this life is a winter to the righteous, and they do not manifest themselves, because they dwell with sinners: for as in winter trees that have cast their leaves are alike, and it is not seen which are dead and which are living, so in this world neither do the righteous show themselves, nor sinners, but all are alike one to another".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 1:48
verses.text: Similitude Fourth.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 1:49
verses.text: As in Summer Living Trees are Distinguished from Withered by Fruit and Living Leaves, So in the World to Come the Just Differ from the Unjust in Happiness.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 1:50
verses.text: He showed me again many trees, some budding, and others withered.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 1:51
verses.text: And he said to me, "Do you see these trees?" "I see, sir," I replied, "some putting forth buds, and others withered".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 1:52
verses.text: "Those," he said, "which are budding are the righteous who are to live in the world to come; for the coming world is the summer of the righteous, but the winter of sinners.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 1:53
verses.text: When, therefore, the mercy of the Lord shines forth, then shall they be made manifest who are the servants of God, and all men shall be made manifest.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 1:54
verses.text: For as in summer the fruits of each individual tree appear, and it is ascertained of what sort they are, so also the fruits of the righteous shall be manifest, and all who have been fruitful in that world shall be made known.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 1:55
verses.text: But the heathen and sinners, like the withered trees which you saw, will be found to be those who have been withered and unfruitful in that world, and shall be burnt as wood, and so made manifest, because their actions were evil during their lives.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 1:56
verses.text: For the sinners shall be consumed because they sinned and did not repent, and the heathen shall be burned because they knew not Him who created them.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 1:57
verses.text: Do you therefore bear fruit, that in that summer your fruit may be known.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 1:58
verses.text: And refrain from much business, and you will never sin: for they who are occupied with much business commit also many sins, being distracted about their affairs, and not at all serving their Lord.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 1:59
verses.text: How, then," he continued, "can such a one ask and obtain anything from the Lord, if he serve Him not? They who serve Him shall obtain their requests, but they who serve Him not shall receive nothing.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 1:60
verses.text: And in the performance even of a single action a man can serve the Lord; for his mind will not be perverted from the Lord, but he will serve Him, having a pure mind.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 1:61
verses.text: If, therefore, you do these things, you shall be able to bear fruit for the life to come.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 1:62
verses.text: And every one who will do these things shall bear fruit".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 1:63
verses.text: Similitude Fifth.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 1:64
verses.text: Of True Fasting and Its Reward: Also of Purity of Body.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 2:1
verses.text: Chapter - 1  While fasting and sitting on a certain mountain, and giving thanks to the Lord for all His dealings with me, I see the Shepherd sitting down beside me, and saying, "Why have you come hither so early in the morning?" "Because, sir," I answered, "I have a station".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 2:2
verses.text: "What is a station?" he asked.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 2:3
verses.text: "I am fasting, sir," I replied.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 2:4
verses.text: "What is this fasting," he continued, "which you are observing?" "As I have been accustomed, sir," I reply, "so I fast".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 2:5
verses.text: "You do not know," he says, "how to fast unto the Lord: this useless fasting which you observe to Him is of no value".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 2:6
verses.text: "Why, sir," I answered, "do you say this?" "I say to you," he continued, "that the fasting which you think you observe is not a fasting.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 2:7
verses.text: But I will teach you what is a full and acceptable fasting to the Lord.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 2:8
verses.text: Listen," he continued: "God does not desire such an empty fasting.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 2:9
verses.text: For fasting to God in this way you will do nothing for a righteous life; but offer to God a fasting of the following kind: Do no evil in your life, and serve the Lord with a pure heart: keep His commandments, walking in His precepts, and let no evil desire arise in your heart; and believe in God.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 2:10
verses.text: If you do these things, and fear Him, and abstain from every evil thing, you will live unto God; and if you do these things, you will keep a great fast, and one acceptable before God".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 3:1
verses.text: Chapter - 2  "Hear the similitude which I am about to narrate to you relative to fasting.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 3:2
verses.text: A certain man had a field and many slaves, and he planted a certain part of the field with a vineyard, and selecting a faithful and beloved and much valued slave, he called him to him, and said, 'Take this vineyard which I have planted, and stake it until I come, and do nothing else to the vineyard; and attend to this order of mine, and you shall receive your freedom from me.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 3:3
verses.text: ' And the master of the slave departed to a foreign country.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 3:4
verses.text: And when he was gone, the slave took and staked the vineyard; and when he had finished the staking of the vines, he saw that the vineyard was full of weeds.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 3:5
verses.text: He then reflected, saying, 'I have kept this order of my master: I will dig up the rest of this vineyard, and it will be more beautiful when dug up; and being free of weeds, it will yield more fruit, not being choked by them.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 3:6
verses.text: ' He took, therefore, and dug up the vineyard, and rooted out all the weeds that were in it.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 3:7
verses.text: And that vineyard became very beautiful and fruitful, having no weeds to choke it.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 3:8
verses.text: And after a certain time the master of the slave and of the field returned, and entered into the vineyard.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 3:9
verses.text: And seeing that the vines were suitably supported on stakes, and the ground, moreover, dug up, and all the weeds rooted out, and the vines fruitful, he was greatly pleased with the work of his slave.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 3:10
verses.text: And calling his beloved son who was his heir, and his friends who were his councillors, he told them what orders he had given his slave, and what he had found performed.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 3:11
verses.text: And they rejoiced along with the slave at the testimony which his master bore to him.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 3:12
verses.text: And he said to them, 'I promised this slave freedom if he obeyed the command which I gave him; and he has kept my command, and done besides a good work to the vineyard, and has pleased me exceedingly.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 3:13
verses.text: In return, therefore, for the work which he has done, I wish to make him co-heir with my son, because, having good thoughts, he did not neglect them, but carried them out.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 3:14
verses.text: ' With this resolution of the master his son and friends were well pleased, viz.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 3:15
verses.text: , that the slave should be co-heir with the son.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 3:16
verses.text: After a few days the master made a feast, and sent to his slave many dishes from his table.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 3:17
verses.text: And the slave receiving the dishes that were sent him from his master, took of them what was sufficient for himself, and distributed the rest among his fellow-slaves.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 3:18
verses.text: And his fellow-slaves rejoiced to receive the dishes, and began to pray for him, that he might find still greater favour with his master for having so treated them.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 3:19
verses.text: His master heard all these things that were done, and was again greatly pleased with his conduct.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 3:20
verses.text: And the master again calling together his friends and his son, reported to them the slave's proceeding with regard to the dishes which he had sent him.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 3:21
verses.text: And they were still more satisfied that the slave should become co-heir with his son".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 4:1
verses.text: Chapter - 3  I said to him, "Sir, I do not see the meaning of these similitudes, nor am I able to comprehend them, unless you explain them to me".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 4:2
verses.text: "I will explain them all to you," he said, "and whatever I shall mention in the course of our conversations I will show you.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 4:3
verses.text: Keep the commandments of the Lord, and you will be approved, and inscribed amongst the number of those who observe His commands.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 4:4
verses.text: And if you do any good beyond what is commanded by God, you will gain for yourself more abundant glory, and will be more honoured by God than you would otherwise be.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 4:5
verses.text: If, therefore, in keeping the commandments of God, you do, in addition, these services, you will have joy if you observe them according to my command".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 4:6
verses.text: I said to him, "Sir, whatsoever you enjoin upon me I will observe, for I know that you are with me".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 4:7
verses.text: "I will be with you," he replied, "because you have such a desire for doing good; and I will be with all those," he added, "who have such a desire.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 4:8
verses.text: This fasting," he continued, "is very good, provided the commandments of the Lord be observed.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 4:9
verses.text: Thus, then, shall you observe the fasting which you intend to keep.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 4:10
verses.text: First of all, be on your guard against every evil word, and every evil desire, and purify your heart from all the vanities of this world.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 4:11
verses.text: If you guard against these things, your fasting will be perfect.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 4:12
verses.text: And you will do also as follows.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 4:13
verses.text: Having fulfilled what is written, in the day on which you fast you will taste nothing but bread and water; and having reckoned up the price of the dishes of that day which you intended to have eaten, you will give it to a widow, or an orphan, or to some person in want, and thus you will exhibit humility of mind, so that he who has received benefit from your humility may fill his own soul, and pray for you to the Lord.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 4:14
verses.text: If you observe fasting, as I have commanded you, your sacrifice will be acceptable to God, and this fasting will be written down; and the service thus performed is noble, and sacred, and acceptable to the Lord.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 4:15
verses.text: These things, therefore, shall you thus observe with your children, and all your house, and in observing them you will be blessed; and as many as hear these words and observe them shall be blessed; and whatsoever they ask of the Lord they shall receive".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 5:1
verses.text: Chapter - 4  I prayed him much that he would explain to me the similitude of the field, and of the master of the vineyard, and of the slave who staked the vineyard, and of the sakes, and of the weeds that were plucked out of the vineyard, and of the son, and of the friends who were fellow-councillors, for I knew that all these things were a kind of parable.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 5:2
verses.text: And he answered me, and said, "You are exceedingly persistent with your questions.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 5:3
verses.text: You ought not," he continued, "to ask any questions at all; for if it is needful to explain anything, it will be made known to you".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 5:4
verses.text: I said to him, "Sir, whatsoever you show me, and do not explain, I shall have seen to no purpose, not understanding its meaning.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 5:5
verses.text: In like manner, also, if you speak parables to me, and do not unfold them, I shall have heard your words in vain".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 5:6
verses.text: And he answered me again, saying, "Every one who is the servant of God, and has his Lord in his heart, asks of Him understanding, and receives it, and opens up every parable; and the words of the Lord become known to him which are spoken in parables.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 5:7
verses.text: But those who are weak and slothful in prayer, hesitate to ask anything from the Lord; but the Lord is full of compassion, and gives without fail to all who ask Him.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 5:8
verses.text: But you, having been strengthened by the holy Angel, and having obtained from Him such intercession, and not being slothful, why do not you ask of the Lord understanding, and receive it from Him?" I said to him, "Sir, having you with me, I am necessitated to ask questions of you, for you show me all things, and converse with me; but if I were to see or hear these things without you, I would then ask the Lord to explain them".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 6:1
verses.text: Chapter - 5  "I said to you a little ago," he answered, "that you were cunning and obstinate in asking explanations of the parables; but since you are so persistent, I shall unfold to you the meaning of the similitudes of the field, and of all the others that follow, that you may make them known to every one.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 6:2
verses.text: Hear now," he said, "and understand them.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 6:3
verses.text: The field is this world; and the Lord of the field is He who created, and perfected, and strengthened all things; and the son is the Holy Spirit; and the slave is the Son of God; and the vines are this people, whom He Himself planted; and the stakes are the holy angels of the Lord, who keep His people together; and the weeds that were plucked out of the vineyard are the iniquities of God's servants; and the dishes which He sent Him from His table are the commandments which He gave His people through His Son; and the friends and fellow-councillors are the holy angels who were first created; and the Master's absence from home is the time that remains until His appearing".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 6:4
verses.text: I said to him, "Sir, all these are great, and marvellous, and glorious things.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 6:5
verses.text: Could I, therefore," I continued, "understand them? No, nor could any other man, even if exceedingly wise.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 6:6
verses.text: Moreover," I added, "explain to me what I am about to ask you".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 6:7
verses.text: "Say what you wish," he replied.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 6:8
verses.text: "Why, sir," I asked, "is the Son of God in the parable in the form of a slave?".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 7:1
verses.text: Chapter - 6  "Hear," he answered: "the Son of God is not in the form of a slave, but in great power and might".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 7:2
verses.text: "How so, sir?" I said; "I do not understand".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 7:3
verses.text: "Because," he answered, "God planted the vineyard, that is to say, He created the people, and gave them to His Son; and the Son appointed His angels over them to keep them; and He Himself purged away their sins, having suffered many trials and undergone many labours, for no one is able to dig without labour and toil.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 7:4
verses.text: He Himself, then, having purged away the sins of the people, showed them the paths of life by giving them the law which He received from His Father.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 7:5
verses.text: You see," he said, "that He is the Lord of the people, having received all authority from His Father.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 7:6
verses.text: And why the Lord took His Son as councillor, and the glorious angels, regarding the heirship of the slave, listen.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 7:7
verses.text: The holy, pre-existent Spirit, that created every creature, God made to dwell in flesh, which He chose.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 7:8
verses.text: This flesh, accordingly, in which the Holy Spirit dwelt, was nobly subject to that Spirit, walking religiously and chastely, in no respect defiling the Spirit; and accordingly, after living excellently and purely, and after labouring and co-operating with the Spirit, and having in everything acted vigorously and courageously along with the Holy Spirit, He assumed it as a partner with it.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 7:9
verses.text: For this conduct of the flesh pleased Him, because it was not defiled on the earth while having the Holy Spirit.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 7:10
verses.text: He took, therefore, as fellow-councillors His Son and the glorious angels, in order that this flesh, which had been subject to the body without a fault, might have some place of tabernacle, and that it might not appear that the reward of its servitude had been lost, for the flesh that has been found without spot or defilement, in which the Holy Spirit dwelt, will receive a reward.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 7:11
verses.text: You have now the explanation of this parable also".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 8:1
verses.text: Chapter - 7  "I rejoice, sir," I said, "to hear this explanation".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 8:2
verses.text: "Hear," again he replied: "Keep this flesh pure and stainless, that the Spirit which inhabits it may bear witness to it, and your flesh may be justified.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 8:3
verses.text: See that the thought never arise in your mind that this flesh of yours is corruptible, and you misuse it by any act of defilement.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 8:4
verses.text: If you defile your flesh, you will also defile the Holy Spirit; and if you defile your flesh and spirit, you will not live".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 8:5
verses.text: "And if any one, sir," I said, "has been hitherto ignorant, before he heard these words, how can such a man be saved who has defiled his flesh?" "Respecting former sins of ignorance," he said, "God alone is able to heal them, for to Him belongs all power.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 8:6
verses.text: But be on your guard now, and the all-powerful and compassionate God will heal former transgressions, if for the time to come you defile not your body nor your spirit; for both are common, and cannot be defiled, the one without the other: keep both therefore pure, and you will live unto God".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 8:7
verses.text: Similitude Sixth.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 8:8
verses.text: Of the Two Classes of Voluptuous Men, and of Their Death, Falling Away, and the Duration of Their Punishment.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 9:1
verses.text: Chapter - 1  Sitting in my house, and glorifying the Lord for all that I had seen, and reflecting on the commandments, that they are excellent, and powerful, and glorious, and able to save a man's soul, I said within myself, "I shall be blessed if I walk in these commandments, and every one who walks in them will be blessed".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 9:2
verses.text: While I was saying these words to myself, I suddenly see him sitting beside me, and hear him thus speak: "Why are you in doubt about the commandments which I gave you? They are excellent: have no doubt about them at all, but put on faith in the Lord, and you will walk in them, for I will strengthen you in them.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 9:3
verses.text: These commandments are beneficial to those who intend to repent: for if they do not walk in them, their repentance is in vain.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 9:4
verses.text: You, therefore, who repent cast away the wickedness of this world which wears you out; and by putting on all the virtues of a holy life, you will be able to keep these commandments, and will no longer add to the number of your sins.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 9:5
verses.text: Walk, therefore, in these commandments of mine, and you will live unto God.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 9:6
verses.text: All these things have been spoken to you by me".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 9:7
verses.text: And after he had uttered these words, he said to me, "Let us go into the fields, and I will show you the shepherds of the flocks".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 9:8
verses.text: "Let us go, sir," I replied.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 9:9
verses.text: And we came to a certain plain, and he showed me a young man, a shepherd, clothed in a suit of garments of a yellow colour: and he was herding very many sheep, and these sheep were feeding luxuriously, as it were, and riotously, and merrily skipping hither and thither.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 9:10
verses.text: The shepherd himself was merry, because of his flock; and the appearance of the shepherd was joyous, and he was running about amongst his flock.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 9:11
verses.text: And other sheep I saw rioting and luxuriating in one place, but not, however, leaping about.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 10:1
verses.text: Chapter - 2  And he said to me, "Do you see this shepherd?" "I see him, sir," I said.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 10:2
verses.text: "This," he answered, "is the angel of luxury and deceit: he wears out the souls of the servants of God, and perverts them from the truth, deceiving them with wicked desires, through which they will perish; for they forget the commandments of the living God, and walk in deceits and empty luxuries; and they are ruined by the angel, some being brought to death, others to corruption".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 10:3
verses.text: I said to him, "Sir, I do not know the meaning of these words, 'to death, and to corruption.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 10:4
verses.text: '" "Listen," he said.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 10:5
verses.text: "The sheep which you saw merry and leaping about, are those which have torn themselves away from God for ever, and have delivered themselves over to luxuries and deceits of this world.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 10:6
verses.text: Among them there is no return to life through repentance, because they have added to their other sins, and blasphemed the name of the Lord.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 10:7
verses.text: Such men therefore, are appointed unto death.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 10:8
verses.text: And the sheep which you saw not leaping, but feeding in one place, are they who have delivered themselves over to luxury and deceit, but have committed no blasphemy against the Lord.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 10:9
verses.text: These have been perverted from the truth: among them there is the hope of repentance, by which it is possible to live.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 10:10
verses.text: Corruption, then, has a hope of a kind of renewal, but death has everlasting ruin".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 10:11
verses.text: Again I went forward a little way, and he showed me a tall shepherd, somewhat savage in his appearance, clothed in a white goatskin, and having a wallet on his shoulders, and a very hard staff with branches, and a large whip.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 10:12
verses.text: And he had a very sour look, so that I was afraid of him, so forbidding was his aspect.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 10:13
verses.text: This shepherd, accordingly, was receiving the sheep from the young shepherd, those, viz.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 10:14
verses.text: , that were rioting and luxuriating, but not leaping; and he cast them into a precipitous place, full of thistles and thorns, so that it was impossible to extricate the sheep from the thorns and thistles; but they were completely entangled amongst them.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 10:15
verses.text: These, accordingly, thus entangled, pastured amongst the thorns and thistles, and were exceedingly miserable, being beaten by him; and he drove them hither and thither, and gave them no rest; and, altogether, these sheep were in a wretched plight.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 11:1
verses.text: Chapter - 3  Seeing them, therefore, so beaten and so badly used, I was grieved for them, because they were so tormented, and had no rest at all.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 11:2
verses.text: And I said to the Shepherd who talked with me, "Sir, who is this shepherd, who is so pitiless and severe, and so completely devoid of compassion for these sheep?" "This," he replied, "is the angel of punishment; and he belongs to the just angels, and is appointed to punish.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 11:3
verses.text: He accordingly takes those who wander away from God, and who have walked in the desires and deceits of this world, and chastises them as they deserve with terrible and diverse punishments".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 11:4
verses.text: "I would know, sir," I said, "Of what nature are these diverse tortures and punishments?" "Hear," he said, "the various tortures and punishments.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 11:5
verses.text: The tortures are such as occur during life.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 11:6
verses.text: For some are punished with losses, others with want, others with sicknesses of various kinds, and others with all kinds of disorder and confusion; others are insulted by unworthy persons, and exposed to suffering in many other ways: for many, becoming unstable in their plans, try many things, and none of them at all succeed, and they say they are not prosperous in their undertakings; and it does not occur to their minds that they have done evil deeds, but they blame the Lord.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 11:7
verses.text: When, therefore, they have been afflicted with all kinds of affliction, then are they delivered unto me for good training, and they are made strong in the faith of the Lord; and for the rest of the days of their life they are subject to the Lord with pure hearts, and are successful in all their undertakings, obtaining from the Lord everything they ask; and then they glorify the Lord, that they were delivered to me, and no longer suffer any evil".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 12:1
verses.text: Chapter - 4  I said to him, "Sir, explain this also to me".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 12:2
verses.text: "What is it you ask?" he said.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 12:3
verses.text: "Whether, sir," I continued, "they who indulge in luxury, and who are deceived, are tortured for the same period of time that they have indulged in luxury and deceit?" He said to me, "They are tortured in the same manner".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 12:4
verses.text: "They are tormented much less, sir," I replied; "for those who are so luxurious and who forget God ought to be tortured seven-fold".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 12:5
verses.text: He said to me "You are foolish, and do not understand the power of torment".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 12:6
verses.text: "Why, sir," I said, "if I had understood it, I would not have asked you to show me".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 12:7
verses.text: "Hear," he said, "the power of both.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 12:8
verses.text: The time of luxury and deceit is one hour; but the hour of torment is equivalent to thirty days.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 12:9
verses.text: If, accordingly, a man indulge in luxury for one day, and be deceived and be tortured for one day, the day of his torture is equivalent to a whole year.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 12:10
verses.text: For all the days of luxury, therefore, there are as many years of torture to be undergone.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 12:11
verses.text: You see, then," he continued, "that the time of luxury and deceit is very short, but that of punishment and torture long".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 13:1
verses.text: Chapter - 5  "Still," I said, "I do not quite understand about the time of deceit, and luxury, and torture; explain it to me more clearly".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 13:2
verses.text: He answered, and said to me, "Your folly is persistent; and you do not wish to purify your heart, and serve God.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 13:3
verses.text: Have a care," he added, "lest the time be fulfilled, and you be found foolish.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 13:4
verses.text: Hear now," he added, "as you desire, that you may understand these things.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 13:5
verses.text: He who indulges in luxury, and is deceived for one day, and who does what he wishes, is clothed with much foolishness, and does not understand the act which he does until the morrow; for he forgets what he did the day before.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 13:6
verses.text: For luxury and deceit have no memories, on account of the folly with which they are clothed; but when punishment and torture cleave to a man for one day, he is punished and tortured for a year; for punishment and torture have powerful memories.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 13:7
verses.text: While tortured and punished, therefore, for a whole year, he remembers at last his luxury and deceit, and knows that on their account he suffers evil.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 13:8
verses.text: Every man, therefore, who is luxurious and deceived is thus tormented, because, although having life, they have given themselves over to death".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 13:9
verses.text: "What kinds of luxury, sir," I asked, "are hurtful?" "Every act of a man which he performs with pleasure," he replied, "is an act of luxury; for the sharp-tempered man, when gratifying his tendency, indulges in luxury; and the adulterer, and the drunkard, and the back-biter, and the liar, and the covetous man, and the thief, and he who does things like these, gratifies his peculiar propensity, and in so doing indulges in luxury.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 13:10
verses.text: All these acts of luxury are hurtful to the servants of God.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 13:11
verses.text: On account of these deceits, therefore, do they suffer, who are punished and tortured.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 13:12
verses.text: And there are also acts of luxury which save men; for many who do good indulge in luxury, being carried away by their own pleasure: this luxury, however, is beneficial to the servants of God, and gains life for such a man; but the injurious acts of luxury before enumerated bring tortures and punishment upon them; and if they continue in them and do not repent, they bring death upon themselves".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 13:13
verses.text: Similitude Seventh.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 13:14
verses.text: They Who Repent Must Bring Forth Fruits Worthy of Repentance.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 13:15
verses.text: After a few days I saw him in the same plain where I had also seen the shepherds; and he said to me, "What do you wish with me?" I said to him, "Sir, that you would order the shepherd who punishes to depart out of my house, because he afflicts me exceedingly".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 13:16
verses.text: "It is necessary," he replied, "that you be afflicted; for thus," he continued, "did the glorious angel command concerning you, as he wishes you to be tried".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 13:17
verses.text: "What have I done which is so bad, sir," I replied, "that I should be delivered over to this angel?" "Listen," he said: "Your sins are many, but not so great as to require that you be delivered over to this angel; but your household has committed great iniquities and sins, and the glorious angel has been incensed at them on account of their deeds; and for this reason he commanded you to be afflicted for a certain time, that they also might repent, and purify themselves from every desire of this world.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 13:18
verses.text: When, therefore, they repent and are purified, then the angel of punishment will depart".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 13:19
verses.text: I said to him, "Sir, if they have done such things as to incense the glorious angel against them, yet what have I done?" He replied, "They cannot be afflicted at all, unless you, the head of the house, be afflicted: for when you are afflicted, of necessity they also suffer affliction; but if you are in comfort, they can feel no affliction".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 13:20
verses.text: "Well, sir," I said, "they have repented with their whole heart".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 13:21
verses.text: "I know, too," he answered, "that they have repented with their whole heart: do you think, however, that the sins of those who repent are remitted? Not altogether, but he who repents must torture his own soul, and be exceedingly humble in all his conduct, and be afflicted with many kinds of affliction; and if he endure the afflictions that come upon him, He who created all things, and endued them with power, will assuredly have compassion, and will heal him; and this will He do when He sees the heart of every penitent pure from every evil thing: and it is profitable for you and for your house to suffer affliction now.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 13:22
verses.text: But why should I say much to you? You must be afflicted, as that angel of the Lord commanded who delivered you to me.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 13:23
verses.text: And for this give thanks to the Lord, because He has deemed you worthy of showing you beforehand this affliction, that, knowing it before it comes, you may be able to bear it with courage".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 13:24
verses.text: I said to him, "Sir, be thou with me, and I will be able to bear all affliction".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 13:25
verses.text: "I will be with you," he said, "and I will ask the angel of punishment to afflict you more lightly; nevertheless, you will be afflicted for a little time, and again you will be re-established in your house.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 13:26
verses.text: Only continue humble, and serve the Lord in all purity of heart, you and your children, and your house, and walk in my commands which I enjoin upon you, and your repentance will be deep and pure; and if you observe these things with your household, every affliction will depart from you.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 13:27
verses.text: And affliction," he added, "will depart from all who walk in these my commandments".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 13:28
verses.text: Similitude Eighth.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 13:29
verses.text: The Sins of the Elect and of the Penitent are of Many Kinds, But All Will Be Rewarded According to the Measure of Their Repentance and Good Works.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 14:1
verses.text: Chapter - 1  He showed me a large willow tree overshadowing plains and mountains, and under the shade of this willow had assembled all those who were called by the name of the Lord.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 14:2
verses.text: And a glorious angel of the Lord, who was very tall, was standing beside the willow, having a large pruning-knife, and he was cutting little twigs from the willow and distributing them among the people that were overshadowed by the willow; and the twigs which he gave them were small, about a cubit, as it were, in length.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 14:3
verses.text: And after they had all received the twigs, the angel laid down the pruning-knife, and that tree was sound, as I had seen it at first.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 14:4
verses.text: And I marvelled within myself, saying, "How is the tree sound, after so many branches have been cut off?" And the Shepherd said to me, "Do not be surprised if the tree remains sound after so many branches were lopped off; but wait, and when you shall have seen everything, then it will be explained to you what it means".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 14:5
verses.text: The angel who had distributed the branches among the people again asked them from them, and in the order in which they had received them were they summoned to him, and each one of them returned his branch.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 14:6
verses.text: And the angel of the Lord took and looked at them.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 14:7
verses.text: From some he received the branches withered and moth-eaten; those who returned branches in that state the angel of the Lord ordered to stand apart.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 14:8
verses.text: Others, again, returned them withered, but not moth-eaten; and these he ordered to stand apart.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 14:9
verses.text: And others returned them half-withered, and these stood apart; and others returned their branches half-withered and having cracks in them, and these stood apart.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 14:10
verses.text: And others returned their branches green and having cracks in them; and these stood apart.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 14:11
verses.text: And others returned their branches, one-half withered and the other green; and these stood apart.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 14:12
verses.text: And others brought their branches two-thirds green and the remaining third withered; and these stood apart.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 14:13
verses.text: And others returned them two-thirds withered and one-third green; and these stood apart.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 14:14
verses.text: And others returned their branches nearly all green, the smallest part only, the top, being withered, but they had cracks in them; and these stood apart.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 14:15
verses.text: And of others very little was green, but the remaining parts withered; and these stood apart.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 14:16
verses.text: And others came bringing their branches green, as they had received them from the angel.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 14:17
verses.text: And the majority of the crowd returned branches of that kind, and with these the angel was exceedingly pleased; and these stood apart.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 14:18
verses.text: And others returned their branches green and having offshoots; and these stood apart, and with these the angel was exceedingly delighted.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 14:19
verses.text: And others returned their branches green and with offshoots, and the offshoots had some fruit, as it were; and those men whose branches were found to be of that kind were exceedingly joyful.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 14:20
verses.text: And the angel was exultant because of them; and the Shepherd also rejoiced greatly because of them.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 15:1
verses.text: Chapter - 2  And the angel of the Lord ordered crowns to be brought; and there were brought crowns, formed, as it were, of palms; and he crowned the men who had returned the branches which had offshoots and some fruit, and sent them away into the tower.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 15:2
verses.text: And the others also he sent into the tower, those, namely, who had returned branches that were green and had offshoots but no fruit, having given them seals.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 15:3
verses.text: And all who went into the tower had the same clothing—white as snow.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 15:4
verses.text: And those who returned their branches green, as they had received them, he set free, giving them clothing and seals.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 15:5
verses.text: Now after the angel had finished these things, he said to the Shepherd, "I am going away, and you will send these away within the walls, according as each one is worthy to have his dwelling.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 15:6
verses.text: And examine their branches carefully, and so dismiss them; but examine them with care.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 15:7
verses.text: See that no one escape you," he added; "and if any escape you, I will try them at the altar".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 15:8
verses.text: Having said these words to the Shepherd, he departed.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 15:9
verses.text: And after the angel had departed, the Shepherd said to me, "Let us take the branches of all these and plant them, and see if any of them will live".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 15:10
verses.text: I said to him, "Sir, how can these withered branches live?" He answered, and said, "This tree is a willow, and of a kind that is very tenacious of life.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 15:11
verses.text: If, therefore, the branches be planted, and receive a little moisture, many of them will live.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 15:12
verses.text: And now let us try, and pour water upon them; and if any of them live I shall rejoice with them, and if they do not I at least will not be found neglectful".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 15:13
verses.text: And the Shepherd bade me call them as each one was placed.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 15:14
verses.text: And they came, rank by rank, and gave their branches to the Shepherd.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 15:15
verses.text: And the Shepherd received the branches, and planted them in rows; and after he had planted them he poured much water upon them, so that the branches could not be seen for the water; and after the branches had drunk it in, he said to me, "Let us go, and return after a few days, and inspect all the branches; for He who created this tree wishes all those to live who received branches from it.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 15:16
verses.text: And I also hope that the greater part of these branches which received moisture and drank of the water will live".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 16:1
verses.text: Chapter - 3  I said to him, "Sir, explain to me what this tree means, for I am perplexed about it, because, after so many branches have been cut off, it continues sound, and nothing appears to have been cut away from it.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 16:2
verses.text: By this, now, I am perplexed".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 16:3
verses.text: "Listen," he said: "This great tree that casts its shadow over plains, and mountains, and all the earth, is the law of God that was given to the whole world; and this law is the Son of God, proclaimed to the ends of the earth; and the people who are under its shadow are they who have heard the proclamation, and have believed upon Him.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 16:4
verses.text: And the great and glorious angel Michael is he who has authority over this people, and governs them; for this is he who gave them the law into the hearts of believers: he accordingly superintends them to whom he gave it, to see if they have kept the same.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 16:5
verses.text: And you see the branches of each one, for the branches are the law.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 16:6
verses.text: You see, accordingly, many branches that have been rendered useless, and you will know them all—those who have not kept the law; and you will see the dwelling of each one".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 16:7
verses.text: I said to him, "Sir, why did he dismiss some into the tower, and leave others to you?" "All," he answered, "who transgressed the law which they received from him, he left under my power for repentance; but all who have satisfied the law, and kept it, he retains under his own authority".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 16:8
verses.text: "Who, then," I continued, "are they who were crowned, and who go to the tower?" "These are they who have suffered on account of the law; but the others, and they who returned their branches green, and with offshoots, but without fruit, are they who have been afflicted on account of the law, but who have not suffered nor denied their law; and they who returned their branches green as they had received them, are the venerable, and the just, and they who have walked carefully in a pure heart, and have kept the commandments of the Lord.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 16:9
verses.text: And the rest you will know when I have examined those branches which have been planted and watered".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 17:1
verses.text: Chapter - 4  And after a few days we came to the place, and the Shepherd sat down in the angel's place, and I stood beside him.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 17:2
verses.text: And he said to me, "Gird yourself with pure, undressed linen made of sackcloth;" and seeing me girded, and ready to minister to him, "Summon," he said, "the men to whom belong the branches that were planted, according to the order in which each one gave them in".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 17:3
verses.text: So I went away to the plain, and summoned them all, and they all stood in their ranks.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 17:4
verses.text: He said to them, "Let each one pull out his own branch, and bring it to me".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 17:5
verses.text: The first to give in were those who had them withered and cut; and because they were found to be thus withered and cut, he commanded them to stand apart.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 17:6
verses.text: And next they gave them in who had them withered, but not cut.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 17:7
verses.text: And some of them gave in their branches green, and some withered and eaten as by a moth.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 17:8
verses.text: Those that gave them in green, accordingly, he ordered to stand apart; and those who gave them in dry and cut, he ordered to stand along with the first.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 17:9
verses.text: Next they gave them in who had them half-withered and cracked; and many of them gave them in green and without cracks; and some green and with offshoots and fruits upon the offshoots, such as they had who went, after being crowned, into the tower.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 17:10
verses.text: And some handed them in withered and eaten, and some withered and uneaten; and some as they were, half-withered and cracked.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 17:11
verses.text: And he commanded them each one to stand apart, some towards their own rows, and others apart from them.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 18:1
verses.text: Chapter - 5  Then they gave in their branches who had them green, but cracked: all these gave them in green, and stood in their own row.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 18:2
verses.text: And the Shepherd was pleased with these, because they were all changed, and had lost their cracks.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 18:3
verses.text: And they also gave them in who had them half-green and half-withered: of some, accordingly, the branches were found completely green; of others, half-withered; of others, withered and eaten; of others, green, and having offshoots.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 18:4
verses.text: All these were sent away, each to his own row.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 18:5
verses.text: Next they gave in who had them two parts green and one-third withered.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 18:6
verses.text: Many of them gave them half-withered; and others withered and rotten; and others half-withered and cracked, and a few green.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 18:7
verses.text: These all stood in their own row.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 18:8
verses.text: And they gave them in who had them green, but to a very slight extent withered and cracked.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 18:9
verses.text: Of these, some gave them in green, and others green and with offshoots.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 18:10
verses.text: And these also went away to their own row.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 18:11
verses.text: Next they gave them who had a very small part green and the other parts withered.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 18:12
verses.text: Of these the branches were found for the most part green and having offshoots, and fruit upon the offshoots, and others altogether green.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 18:13
verses.text: With these branches the Shepherd was exceedingly pleased, because they were found in this state.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 18:14
verses.text: And these went away, each to his own row.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 19:1
verses.text: Chapter - 6  After the Shepherd had examined the branches of them all, he said to me, "I told you that this tree was tenacious of life.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 19:2
verses.text: You see," he continued, "how many repented and were saved".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 19:3
verses.text: "I see, sir," I replied.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 19:4
verses.text: "That you may behold," he added, "the great mercy of the Lord, that it is great and glorious, and that He has given His Spirit to those who are worthy of repentance".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 19:5
verses.text: "Why then, sir," I said, "did not all these repent?" He answered, "To them whose heart He saw would become pure, and obedient to Him, He gave power to repent with the whole heart.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 19:6
verses.text: But to them whose deceit and wickedness He perceived, and saw that they intended to repent hypocritically, He did not grant repentance, lest they should again profane His name".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 19:7
verses.text: I said to him, "Sir, show me now, with respect to those who gave in the branches, of what sort they are, and their abode, in order that they hearing it who believed, and received the seal, and broke it, and did not keep it whole, may, on coming to a knowledge of their deeds, repent, and receive from you a seal, and may glorify the Lord because He had compassion upon them, and sent you to renew their spirits".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 19:8
verses.text: "Listen," he said: "they whose branches were found withered and moth-eaten are the apostates and traitors of the Church, who have blasphemed the Lord in their sins, and have, moreover, been ashamed of the name of the Lord by which they were called.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 19:9
verses.text: These, therefore, at the end were lost unto God.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 19:10
verses.text: And you see that not a single one of them repented, although they heard the words which I spake to them, which I enjoined upon you.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 19:11
verses.text: From such life departed.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 19:12
verses.text: And they who gave them in withered and undecayed, these also were near to them; for they were hypocrites, and introducers of strange doctrines, and subverters of the servants of God, especially of those who had sinned, not allowing them to repent, but persuading them by foolish doctrines.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 19:13
verses.text: These, accordingly, have a hope of repentance.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 19:14
verses.text: And you see that many of them also have repented since I spake to them, and they will still repent.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 19:15
verses.text: But all who will not repent have lost their lives; and as many of them as repented became good, and their dwelling was appointed within the first walls; and some of them ascended even into the tower.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 19:16
verses.text: You see, then," he said, "that repentance involves life to sinners, but non-repentance death".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 20:1
verses.text: Chapter - 7  "And as many as gave in the branches half-withered and cracked, hear also about them.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 20:2
verses.text: They whose branches were half-withered to the same extent are the wavering; for they neither live, nor are they dead.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 20:3
verses.text: And they who have them half-withered and cracked are both waverers and slanderers, railing against the absent, and never at peace with one another, but always at variance.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 20:4
verses.text: And yet to these also," he continued, "repentance is possible.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 20:5
verses.text: You see," he said, "that some of them have repented, and there is still remaining in them," he continued, "a hope of repentance.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 20:6
verses.text: And as many of them," he added, "as have repented, shall have their dwelling in the tower.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 20:7
verses.text: And those of them who have been slower in repenting shall dwell within the walls.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 20:8
verses.text: And as many as do not repent at all, but abide in their deeds, shall utterly perish.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 20:9
verses.text: And they who gave in their branches green and cracked were always faithful and good, though emulous of each other about the foremost places, and about fame: now all these are foolish, in indulging in such a rivalry.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 20:10
verses.text: Yet they also, being naturally good, on hearing my commandments, purified themselves, and soon repented.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 20:11
verses.text: Their dwelling, accordingly, was in the tower.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 20:12
verses.text: But if any one relapse into strife, he will be east out of the tower, and will lose his life.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 20:13
verses.text: Life is the possession of all who keep the commandments of the Lord; but in the commandments there is no rivalry in regard to the first places, or glory of any kind, but in regard to patience and personal humility.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 20:14
verses.text: Among such persons, then, is the life of the Lord, but amongst the quarrelsome and transgressors, death".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 21:1
verses.text: Chapter - 8  "And they who gave in their branches half-green and half-withered, are those who are immersed in business, and do not cleave to the saints.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 21:2
verses.text: For this reason, the one half of them is living, and the other half dead.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 21:3
verses.text: Many, accordingly, who heard my commands repented, and those at least who repented had their dwelling in the tower.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 21:4
verses.text: But some of them at last fell away: these, accordingly, have not repentance, for on account of their business they blasphemed the Lord, and denied Him.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 21:5
verses.text: They therefore lost their lives through the wickedness which they committed.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 21:6
verses.text: And many of them doubted.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 21:7
verses.text: These still have repentance in their power, if they repent speedily; and their abode will be in the tower.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 21:8
verses.text: But if they are slower in repenting, they will dwell within the walls; and if they do not repent, they too have lost their lives.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 21:9
verses.text: And they who gave in their branches two-thirds withered and one-third green, are those who have denied the Lord in various ways.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 21:10
verses.text: Many, however, repented, but some of them hesitated and were in doubt.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 21:11
verses.text: These, then, have repentance within their reach, if they repent quickly, and do not remain in their pleasures; but if they abide in their deeds, these, too, work to themselves death".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 22:1
verses.text: Chapter - 9  "And they who returned their branches two-thirds withered and one-third green, are those that were faithful indeed; but after acquiring wealth, and becoming distinguished amongst the heathen, they clothed themselves with great pride, and became lofty-minded, and deserted the truth, and did not cleave to the righteous, but lived with the heathen, and this way of life became more agreeable to them.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 22:2
verses.text: They did not, however, depart from God, but remained in the faith, although not working the works of faith.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 22:3
verses.text: Many of them accordingly repented, and their dwelling was in the tower.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 22:4
verses.text: And others continuing to live until the end with the heathen, and being corrupted by their vain glories, departed from God, serving the works and deeds of the heathen.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 22:5
verses.text: These were reckoned with the heathen.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 22:6
verses.text: But others of them hesitated, not hoping to be saved on account of the deeds which they had done; while others were in doubt, and caused divisions among themselves.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 22:7
verses.text: To those, therefore, who were in doubt on account of their deeds, repentance is still open; but their repentance ought to be speedy, that their dwelling may be in the tower.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 22:8
verses.text: And to those who do not repent, but abide in their pleasures, death is near".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 23:1
verses.text: Chapter - 10  "And they who give in their branches green, but having the tips withered and cracked, these were always good, and faithful, and distinguished before God; but they sinned a very little through indulging small desires, and finding little faults with one another.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 23:2
verses.text: But on hearing my words the greater part of them quickly repented, and their dwelling was upon the tower.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 23:3
verses.text: Yet some of them were in doubt; and certain of them who were in doubt wrought greater dissension.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 23:4
verses.text: Among these, therefore, is hope of repentance, because they were always good; and with difficulty will any one of them perish.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 23:5
verses.text: And they who gave up their branches withered, but having a very small part green, are those who believed only, yet continue working the works of iniquity.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 23:6
verses.text: They never, however, departed from God, but gladly bore His name, and joyfully received His servants into their houses.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 23:7
verses.text: Having accordingly heard of this repentance, they unhesitatingly repented, and practice all virtue and righteousness; and some of them even suffered, being willingly put to death , knowing their deeds which they had done.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 23:8
verses.text: Of all these, therefore, the dwelling shall be in the tower".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 24:1
verses.text: Chapter - 11  And after he had finished the explanations of all the branches, he said to me, "Go and tell them to every one, that they may repent, and they shall live unto God.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 24:2
verses.text: Because the Lord, having had compassion on all men, has sent me to give repentance, although some are not worthy of it on account of their works; but the Lord, being long-suffering, desires those who were called by His Son to be saved".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 24:3
verses.text: I said to him, "Sir, I hope that all who have heard them will repent; for I am persuaded that each one, on coming to a knowledge of his own works, and fearing the Lord, will repent".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 24:4
verses.text: He answered me, and said, "All who with their whole heart shall purify themselves from their wickedness before enumerated, and shall add no more to their sins, will receive healing from the Lord for their former transgressions, if they do not hesitate at these commandments; and they will live unto God.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 24:5
verses.text: But do you walk in my commandments, and live".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 24:6
verses.text: Having shown me these things, and spoken all these words, he said to me, "And the rest I will show you after a few days".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 24:7
verses.text: Similitude Ninth.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 24:8
verses.text: The Great Mysteries in the Building of the Militant and Triumphant Church.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 25:1
verses.text: Chapter - 1  After I had written down the commandments and similitudes of the Shepherd, the angel of repentance, he came to me and said, "I wish to explain to you what the Holy Spirit that spake with you in the form of the Church showed you, for that Spirit is the Son of God.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 25:2
verses.text: For, as you were somewhat weak in the flesh, it was not explained to you by the angel.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 25:3
verses.text: When, however, you were strengthened by the Spirit, and your strength was increased, so that you were able to see the angel also, then accordingly was the building of the tower shown you by the Church.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 25:4
verses.text: In a noble and solemn manner did you see everything as if shown you by a virgin; but now you see them through the same Spirit as if shown by an angel.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 25:5
verses.text: You must, however, learn everything from me with greater accuracy.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 25:6
verses.text: For I was sent for this purpose by the glorious angel to dwell in your house, that you might see all things with power, entertaining no fear, even as it was before".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 25:7
verses.text: And he led me away into Arcadia, to a round hill; and he placed me on the top of the hill, and showed me a large plain, and round about the plain twelve mountains, all having different forms.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 25:8
verses.text: The first was black as soot; and the second bare, without grass; and the third full of thorns and thistles; and the fourth with grass half-withered, the upper parts of the plants green, and the parts about the roots withered; and some of the grasses, when the sun scorched them, became withered.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 25:9
verses.text: And the fifth mountain had green grass, and was ragged.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 25:10
verses.text: And the sixth mountain was quite full of clefts, some small and others large; and the clefts were grassy, but the plants were not very vigorous, but rather, as it were, decayed.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 25:11
verses.text: The seventh mountain, again, had cheerful pastures, and the whole mountain was blooming, and every kind of cattle and birds were feeding upon that mountain; and the more the cattle and the birds ate, the more the grass of that mountain flourished.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 25:12
verses.text: And the eighth mountain was full of fountains, and every kind of the Lord's creatures drank of the fountains of that mountain.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 25:13
verses.text: But the ninth mountain had no water at all, and was wholly a desert, and had within it deadly serpents, which destroy men.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 25:14
verses.text: And the tenth mountain had very large trees, and was completely shaded, and under the shadow of the trees sheep lay resting and ruminating.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 25:15
verses.text: And the eleventh mountain was very thickly wooded, and those trees were productive, being adorned with various sorts of fruits, so that any one seeing them would desire to eat of their fruits.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 25:16
verses.text: The twelfth mountain, again, was wholly white, and its aspect was cheerful, and the mountain in itself was very beautiful.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 26:1
verses.text: Chapter - 2  And in the middle of the plain he showed me a large white rock that had arisen out of the plain.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 26:2
verses.text: And the rock was more lofty than the mountains, rectangular in shape, so as to be capable of containing the whole world: and that rock was old, having a gate cut out of it; and the cutting out of the gate seemed to me as if recently done.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 26:3
verses.text: And the gate glittered to such a degree under the sunbeams, that I marvelled at the splendour of the gate; and round about the gate were standing twelve virgins.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 26:4
verses.text: The four who stood at the corners seemed to me more distinguished than the others—they were all, however, distinguished—and they were standing at the four parts of the gate; two virgins between each part.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 26:5
verses.text: And they were clothed with linen tunics, and gracefully girded, having their right shoulders exposed, as if about to bear some burden.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 26:6
verses.text: Thus they stood ready; for they were exceedingly cheerful and eager.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 26:7
verses.text: After I had seen these things, I marvelled in myself, because I was beholding great and glorious sights.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 26:8
verses.text: And again I was perplexed about the virgins, because, although so delicate, they were standing courageously, as if about to carry the whole heavens.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 26:9
verses.text: And the Shepherd said to me "Why are you reasoning in yourself, and perplexing your mind, and distressing yourself? for the things which you cannot understand, do not attempt to comprehend, as if you were wise; but ask the Lord, that you may receive understanding and know them.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 26:10
verses.text: You cannot see what is behind you, but you see what is before.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 26:11
verses.text: Whatever, then, you cannot see, let alone, and do not torment yourself about it: but what you see, make yourself master of it, and do not waste your labour about other things; and I will explain to you everything that I show you.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 26:12
verses.text: Look therefore, on the things that remain".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 27:1
verses.text: Chapter - 3  I saw six men come, tall, and distinguished, and similar in appearance, and they summoned a multitude of men.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 27:2
verses.text: And they who came were also tall men, and handsome, and powerful; and the six men commanded them to build a tower above the rock.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 27:3
verses.text: And great was the noise of those men who came to build the tower, as they ran hither and thither around the gate.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 27:4
verses.text: And the virgins who stood around the gate told the men to hasten to build the tower.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 27:5
verses.text: Now the virgins had spread out their hands, as if about to receive something from the men.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 27:6
verses.text: And the six men commanded stones to ascend out of a certain pit, and to go to the building of the tower.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 27:7
verses.text: And there went up ten shining rectangular stones, not hewn in a quarry.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 27:8
verses.text: And the six men called the virgins, and bade them carry all the stones that were intended for the building, and to pass through the gate, and give them to the men who were about to build the tower.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 27:9
verses.text: And the virgins put upon one another the ten first stones which had ascended from the pit, and carried them together, each stone by itself.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 28:1
verses.text: Chapter - 4  And as they stood together around the gate, those who seemed to be strong carried them, and they stooped down under the corners of the stone; and the others stooped down under the sides of the stones.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 28:2
verses.text: And in this way they carried all the stones.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 28:3
verses.text: And they carried them through the gate as they were commanded, and gave them to the men for the tower; and they took the stones and proceeded with the building.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 28:4
verses.text: Now the tower was built upon the great rock, and above the gate.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 28:5
verses.text: Those ten stones were prepared as the foundation for the building of the tower.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 28:6
verses.text: And the rock and gate were the support of the whole of the tower.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 28:7
verses.text: And after the ten stones other twenty five came up out of the pit, and these were fitted into the building of the tower, being carried by the virgins as before.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 28:8
verses.text: And after these ascended thirty-five.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 28:9
verses.text: And these in like manner were fitted into the tower.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 28:10
verses.text: And after these other forty stones came up; and all these were cast into the building of the tower, and there were four rows in the foundation of the tower, and they ceased ascending from the pit.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 28:11
verses.text: And the builders also ceased for a little.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 28:12
verses.text: And again the six men commanded the multitude of the crowd to bear stones from the mountains for the building of the tower.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 28:13
