verses.text: They were accordingly brought from all the mountains of various colours, and being hewn by the men were given to the virgins; and the virgins carried them through the gate, and gave them for the building of the tower.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 28:14
verses.text: And when the stones of various colours were placed in the building, they all became white alike, and lost their different colours.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 28:15
verses.text: And certain stones were given by the men for the building, and these did not become shining; but as they were placed, such also were they found to remain: for they were not given by the virgins, nor carried through the gate.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 28:16
verses.text: These stones, therefore, were not in keeping with the others in the building of the tower.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 28:17
verses.text: And the six men, seeing these unsuitable stones in the building, commanded them to be taken away, and to be carried away down to their own place whence they had been taken; and being removed one by one, they were laid aside; and they say to the men who brought the stones, "Do not ye bring any stones at all for the building, but lay them down beside the tower, that the virgins may carry them through the gate, and may give them for the building.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 28:18
verses.text: For unless," they said, "they be carried through the gate by the hands of the virgins, they cannot change their colours: do not toil, therefore," they said, "to no purpose".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 29:1
verses.text: Chapter - 5  And on that day the building was finished, but the tower was not completed; for additional building was again about to be added, and there was a cessation in the building.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 29:2
verses.text: And the six men commanded the builders all to withdraw a little distance, and to rest, but enjoined the virgins not to withdraw from the tower; and it seemed to me that the virgins had been left to guard the tower.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 29:3
verses.text: Now after all had withdrawn, and were resting themselves, I said to the Shepherd, "What is the reason that the building of the tower was not finished?" "The tower," he answered, "cannot be finished just yet, until the Lord of it come and examine the building, in  order that, if any of the stones be found to be decayed, he may change them: for the tower is built according to his pleasure".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 29:4
verses.text: "I would like to know, sir," I said, "what is the meaning of the building of this tower, and what the rock and gate, and the mountains, and the virgins mean, and the stones that ascended from the pit, and were not hewn, but came as they were to the building.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 29:5
verses.text: Why, in the first place, were ten stones placed in the foundation, then twenty-five, then thirty-five, then forty? and I wish also to know about the stones that went to the building, and were again taken out and returned to their own place? On all these points put my mind at rest, sir, and explain them to me".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 29:6
verses.text: "If you are not found to be curious about trifles," he replied, "you shall know everything.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 29:7
verses.text: For after a few days we shall come hither, and you will see the other things that happen to this tower, and will know accurately all the similitudes".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 29:8
verses.text: After a few days we came to the place where we sat down.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 29:9
verses.text: And he said to me, "Let us go to the tower; for the master of the tower is coming to examine it".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 29:10
verses.text: And we came to the tower, and there was no one at all near it, save the virgins only.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 29:11
verses.text: And the Shepherd asked the virgins if perchance the master of the tower had come; and they replied that he was about to come to examine the building.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 30:1
verses.text: Chapter - 6  And, behold, after a little I see an array of many men coming, and in the midst of them one man of so remarkable a size as to overtop the tower.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 30:2
verses.text: And the six men who had worked upon the building were with him, and many other honourable men were around him.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 30:3
verses.text: And the virgins who kept the tower ran forward and kissed him, and began to walk near him around the tower.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 30:4
verses.text: And that man examined the building carefully, feeling every stone separately; and holding a rod in his hand, he struck every stone in the building three times.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 30:5
verses.text: And when he struck them, some of them became black as soot, and some appeared as if covered with scabs, and some cracked, and some mutilated, and some neither white nor black, and some rough and not in keeping with the other stones, and some having very many stains: such were the varieties of decayed stones that were found in the building.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 30:6
verses.text: He ordered all these to be taken out of the tower, and to be laid down beside it, and other stones to be brought and put in their stead.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 30:7
verses.text: And the builders asked him from what mountain he wished them to be brought and put in their place.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 30:8
verses.text: And he did not command them to be brought from the mountains, but he bade them be brought from a certain plain which was near at hand.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 30:9
verses.text: And the plain was dug up, and shining rectangular stones were found, and some also of a round shape; and all the stones which were in that plain were brought, and carried through the gate by the virgins.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 30:10
verses.text: And the rectangular stones were hewn, and put in place of those that were taken away; but the rounded stones were not put into the building, because they were hard to hew, and appeared to yield slowly to the chisel; they were deposited, however, beside the tower, as if intended to be hewn and used in the building, for they were exceedingly brilliant.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 31:1
verses.text: Chapter - 7  The glorious man, the lord of the whole tower, having accordingly finished these alterations, called to him the Shepherd, and delivered to him all the stones that were lying beside the tower, that had been rejected from the building, and said to him, "Carefully clean all these stones, and put aside such for the building of the tower as may harmonize with the others; and those that do not, throw far away from the tower".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 31:2
verses.text: Having given these orders to the Shepherd, he departed from the tower, with all those with whom he had come.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 31:3
verses.text: Now the virgins were standing around the tower, keeping it.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 31:4
verses.text: I said again to the Shepherd, "Can these stones return to the building of the tower, after being rejected?" He answered me, and said, "Do you see these stones?" "I see them, sir," I replied.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 31:5
verses.text: "The greater part of these stones," he said, "I will hew, and put into the building, and they will harmonize with the others".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 31:6
verses.text: "How, sir," I said, "can they, after being cut all round about, fill up the same space?" He answered, "Those that shall be found small will be thrown into the middle of the building, and those that are larger will be placed on the outside, and they will hold them together".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 31:7
verses.text: Having spoken these words, he said to me, "Let us go, and after two days let us come and clean these stones, and cast them into the building; for all things around the tower must be cleaned, lest the Master come suddenly and find the places about the tower dirty, and be displeased, and these stones be not returned for the building of the tower, and I also shall seem to be neglectful towards the Master".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 31:8
verses.text: And after two days we came to the tower, and he said to me, "Let us examine all the stones, and ascertain those which may return to the building".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 31:9
verses.text: I said to him, "Sir, let us examine them!".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 32:1
verses.text: Chapter - 8  And beginning, we first examined the black stones.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 32:2
verses.text: And such as they had been taken out of the building, were they found to remain; and the Shepherd ordered them to be removed out of the tower, and to be placed apart.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 32:3
verses.text: Next he examined those that had scabs; and he took and hewed many of these, and commanded the virgins to take them up and cast them into the building.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 32:4
verses.text: And the virgins lifted them up, and put them in the middle of the building of the tower.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 32:5
verses.text: And the rest he ordered to be laid down beside the black ones; for these, too, were found to be black.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 32:6
verses.text: He next examined those that had cracks; and he hewed many of these, and commanded them to be carried by the virgins to the building: and they were placed on the outside, because they were found to be sounder than the others; but the rest, on account of the multitude of the cracks, could not be hewn, and for this reason, therefore, they were rejected from the building of the tower.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 32:7
verses.text: He next examined the chipped stones, and many amongst these were found to be black, and some to have great cracks.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 32:8
verses.text: And these also he commanded to be laid down along with those which had been rejected.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 32:9
verses.text: But the remainder, after being cleaned and hewn, he commanded to be placed in the building.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 32:10
verses.text: And the virgins took them up, and fitted them into the middle of the building of the tower, for they were somewhat weak.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 32:11
verses.text: He next examined those that were half white and half black, and many of them were found to be black.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 32:12
verses.text: And he commanded these also to be taken away along with those which had been rejected.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 32:13
verses.text: And the rest were all taken away by the virgins; for, being white, they were fitted by the virgins themselves into the building.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 32:14
verses.text: And they were placed upon the outside, because they were found to be sound, so as to be able to support those which were placed in the middle, for no part of them at all was chipped.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 32:15
verses.text: He next examined those that were rough and hard; and a few of them were rejected because they could not be hewn, as they were found exceedingly hard.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 32:16
verses.text: But the rest of them were hewn, and carried by the virgins, and fitted into the middle of the building of the tower; for they were somewhat weak.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 32:17
verses.text: He next examined those that had stains; and of these a very few were black, and were thrown aside with the others; but the greater part were found to be bright, and these were fitted by the virgins into the building, but on account of their strength were placed on the outside.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 33:1
verses.text: Chapter - 9  He next came to examine the white and rounded stones, and said to me, "What are we to do with these stones?" "How do I know, sir?" I replied.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 33:2
verses.text: "Have you no intentions regarding them?" "Sir," I answered, "I am not acquainted with this art, neither am I a stone-cutter, nor can I tell".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 33:3
verses.text: "Do you not see," he said, "that they are exceedingly round? and if I wish to make them rectangular, a large portion of them must be cut away; for some of them must of necessity be put into the building".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 33:4
verses.text: "If therefore," I said, "they must, why do you torment yourself, and not at once choose for the building those which you prefer, and fit them into it?" He selected the larger ones among them, and the shining ones, and hewed them; and the virgins carried and fitted them into the outside parts of the building.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 33:5
verses.text: And the rest which remained over were carried away, and laid down on the plain from which they were brought.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 33:6
verses.text: They were not, however, rejected, "because," he said, "there remains yet a little addition to be built to the tower.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 33:7
verses.text: And the lord of this tower wishes all the stones to be fitted into the building, because they are exceedingly bright".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 33:8
verses.text: And twelve women were called, very beautiful in form, clothed in black, and with dishevelled hair.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 33:9
verses.text: And these women seemed to me to be fierce.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 33:10
verses.text: But the Shepherd commanded them to lift the stones that were rejected from the building, and to carry them away to the mountains from which they had been brought.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 33:11
verses.text: And they were merry, and carried away all the stones, and put them in the place whence they had been taken.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 33:12
verses.text: Now after all the stones were removed, and there was no longer a single one lying around the tower, he said, "Let us go round the tower and see, lest there be any defect in it".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 33:13
verses.text: So I went round the tower along with him.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 33:14
verses.text: And the Shepherd, seeing that the tower was beautifully built, rejoiced exceedingly; for the tower was built in such a way, that, on seeing it, I coveted the building of it, for it was constructed as if built of one stone, without a single joining.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 33:15
verses.text: And the stone seemed as if hewn out of the rock; having to me the appearance of a monolith.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 34:1
verses.text: Chapter - 10  And as I walked along with him, I was full of joy, beholding so many excellent things.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 34:2
verses.text: And the Shepherd said to me, "Go and bring unslacked lime and fine-baked clay, that I may fill up the forms of the stones that were taken and thrown into the building; for everything about the tower must be smooth".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 34:3
verses.text: And I did as he commanded me, and brought it to him.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 34:4
verses.text: "Assist me," he said, "and the work will soon be finished".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 34:5
verses.text: He accordingly filled up the forms of the stones that were returned to the building, and commanded the places around the tower to be swept and to be cleaned; and the virgins  took brooms and swept the place, and carried all the dirt out of the tower, and brought water, and the ground around the tower became cheerful and very beautiful.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 34:6
verses.text: Says the Shepherd to me, "Everything has been cleared away; if the lord of the tower come to inspect it, he can have no fault to find with us".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 34:7
verses.text: Having spoken these words, he wished to depart; but I laid hold of him by the wallet, and began to adjure him by the Lord that he would explain what he had showed me.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 34:8
verses.text: He said to me, "I must rest a little, and then I shall explain to you everything; wait for me here until I return".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 34:9
verses.text: I said to him, "Sir, what can I do here alone?" "You are not alone," he said, "for these virgins are with you".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 34:10
verses.text: "Give me in charge to them, then," I replied.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 34:11
verses.text: The Shepherd called them to him, and said to them, "I entrust him to you until I come," and went away.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 34:12
verses.text: And I was alone with the virgins; and they were rather merry, but were friendly to me, especially the four more distinguished of them.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 35:1
verses.text: Chapter - 11  The virgins said to me, "The Shepherd does not come here to-day".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 35:2
verses.text: "What, then," said I, "am I to do?" They replied, "Wait for him until he comes; and if he comes he will converse with you, and if he does not come you will remain here with us until he does come".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 35:3
verses.text: I said to them, "I will wait for him until it is late; and if he does not arrive, I will go away into the house, and come back early in the morning".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 35:4
verses.text: And they answered and said to me, "You were entrusted to us; you cannot go away from us".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 35:5
verses.text: "Where, then," I said, "am I to remain?" "You will sleep with us," they replied, "as a brother, and not as a husband: for you are our brother, and for the time to come we intend to abide with you, for we love you exceedingly!" But I was ashamed to remain with them.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 35:6
verses.text: And she who seemed to be the first among them began to kiss me.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 35:7
verses.text: And the others seeing her kissing me, began also to kiss me, and to lead me round the tower, and to play with me.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 35:8
verses.text: And I, too, became like a young man, and began to play with them: for some of them formed a chorus, and others danced, and others sang; and I, keeping silence, walked with them around the tower, and was merry with them.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 35:9
verses.text: And when it grew late I wished to go into the house; and they would not let me, but detained me.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 35:10
verses.text: So I remained with them during the night, and slept beside the tower.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 35:11
verses.text: Now the virgins spread their linen tunics on the ground, and made me lie down in the midst of them; and they did nothing at all but pray; and I without ceasing prayed with them, and not less than they.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 35:12
verses.text: And the virgins rejoiced because I thus prayed.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 35:13
verses.text: And I remained there with the virgins until the next day at the second hour.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 35:14
verses.text: Then the Shepherd returned, and said to the virgins, "Did you offer him any insult?" "Ask him," they said.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 35:15
verses.text: I said to him, "Sir, I was delighted that I remained with them".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 35:16
verses.text: "On what," he asked, "did you sup?" "I supped, sir," I replied, "on the words of the Lord the whole night".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 35:17
verses.text: "Did they receive you well?" he inquired.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 35:18
verses.text: "Yes, sir," I answered.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 35:19
verses.text: "Now," he said, "what do you wish to hear first?" "I wish to hear in the order," I said, "in which you showed me from the beginning.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 35:20
verses.text: I beg of you, sir, that as I shall ask you, so also you will give me the explanation".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 35:21
verses.text: "As you wish," he replied, "so also will I explain to you, and will conceal nothing at all from you".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 36:1
verses.text: Chapter - 12  "First of all, sir," I said, "explain this to me: What is the meaning of the rock and the gate?" "This rock," he answered, "and this gate are the Son of God".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 36:2
verses.text: "How, sir?" I said; "the rock is old, and the gate is new".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 36:3
verses.text: "Listen," he said, "and understand, O ignorant man.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 36:4
verses.text: The Son of God is older than all His creatures, so that He was a fellow-councillor with the Father in His work of creation: for this reason is He old".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 36:5
verses.text: "And why is the gate new, sir?" I said.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 36:6
verses.text: "Because," he answered, "He became manifest in the last days of the dispensation: for this reason the gate was made new, that they who are to be saved by it might enter into the kingdom of God.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 36:7
verses.text: You saw," he said, "that those stones which came in through the gate were used for the building of the tower, and that those which did not come, were again thrown back to their own place?" "I saw, sir," I replied.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 36:8
verses.text: "In like manner," he continued, "no one shall enter into the kingdom of God unless he receive His holy name.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 36:9
verses.text: For if you desire to enter into a city, and that city is surrounded by a wall, and has but one gate, can you enter into that city save through the gate which it has?" "Why, how can it be otherwise, sir?" I said.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 36:10
verses.text: "If, then, you cannot enter  into the city except through its gate, so, in like manner, a man cannot otherwise enter into the kingdom of God than by the name of His beloved Son.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 36:11
verses.text: You saw," he added, "the multitude who were building the tower?" "I saw them, sir," I said.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 36:12
verses.text: "Those," he said, "are all glorious angels, and by them accordingly is the Lord surrounded.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 36:13
verses.text: And the gate is the Son of God.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 36:14
verses.text: This is the one entrance to the Lord.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 36:15
verses.text: In no other way, then, shall any one enter in to Him except through His Son.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 36:16
verses.text: You saw," he continued, "the six men, and the tall and glorious man in the midst of them, who walked round the tower, and rejected the stones from the building?" "I saw him, sir," I answered.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 36:17
verses.text: "The glorious man," he said, "is the Son of God, and those six glorious angels are those who support Him on the right hand and on the left.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 36:18
verses.text: None of these glorious angels," he continued, "will enter in unto God apart from Him.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 36:19
verses.text: Whosoever does not receive His name, shall not enter into the kingdom of God".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 37:1
verses.text: Chapter - 13  "And the tower," I asked, "what does it mean?" "This tower," he replied, "is the Church".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 37:2
verses.text: "And these virgins, who are they?" "They are holy spirits, and men cannot otherwise be found in the kingdom of God unless these have put their clothing upon them: for if you receive the name only, and do not receive from them the clothing, they are of no advantage to you.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 37:3
verses.text: For these virgins are the powers of the Son of God.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 37:4
verses.text: If you bear His name but possess not His power, it will be in vain that you bear His name.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 37:5
verses.text: Those stones," he continued, "which you saw rejected bore His name, but did not put on the clothing of the virgins".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 37:6
verses.text: "Of what nature is their clothing, sir?" I asked.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 37:7
verses.text: "Their very names," he said, "are their clothing.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 37:8
verses.text: Every one who bears the name of the Son of God, ought to bear the names also of these; for the Son Himself bears the names of these virgins.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 37:9
verses.text: As many stones," he continued, "as you saw come into the building of the tower through the hands of these virgins, and remaining, have been clothed with their strength.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 37:10
verses.text: For this reason you see that the tower became of one stone with the rock.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 37:11
verses.text: So also they who have believed on the Lord through His Son, and are clothed with these spirits, shall become one spirit, one body, and the colour of their garments shall be one.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 37:12
verses.text: And the dwelling of such as bear the names of the virgins is in the tower".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 37:13
verses.text: "Those stones, sir, that were rejected," I inquired, "on what account were they rejected? for they passed through the gate, and were placed by the hands of the virgins in the building of the tower".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 37:14
verses.text: "Since you take an interest in everything," he replied, "and examine minutely, hear about the stones that were rejected.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 37:15
verses.text: These all," he said, "received the name of God, and they received also the strength of these virgins.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 37:16
verses.text: Having received, then, these spirits, they were made strong, and were with the servants of God; and theirs was one spirit, and one body, and one clothing.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 37:17
verses.text: For they were of the same mind, and wrought righteousness.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 37:18
verses.text: After a certain time, however, they were persuaded by the women whom you saw clothed in black, and having their shoulders exposed and their hair dishevelled, and beautiful in appearance.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 37:19
verses.text: Having seen these women, they desired to have them, and clothed themselves with their strength, and put off the strength of the virgins.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 37:20
verses.text: These, accordingly, were rejected from the house of God, and were given over to these women.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 37:21
verses.text: But they who were not deceived by the beauty of these women remained in the house of God.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 37:22
verses.text: You have," he said, "the explanation of those who were rejected".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 38:1
verses.text: Chapter - 14  "What, then, sir," I said, "if these men, being such as they are, repent and put away their desires after these women, and return again to the virgins, and walk in their strength and in their works, shall they not enter into the house of God?" "They shall enter in," he said, "if they put away the works of these women, and put on again the strength of the virgins, and walk in their works.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 38:2
verses.text: For on this account was there a cessation in the building, in order that, if these repent, they may depart into the building of the tower.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 38:3
verses.text: But if they do not repent, then others will come in their place, and these at the end will be cast out.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 38:4
verses.text: For all these things I gave thanks to the Lord, because He had pity on all that call upon His name; and sent the angel of repentance to us who sinned against Him, and renewed our spirit; and when we were already destroyed, and had no hope of life, He restored us to newness of life".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 38:5
verses.text: "Now, sir," I continued, "show me why the tower was not built upon the ground, but upon the rock and upon the gate".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 38:6
verses.text: "Are you still," he said, "without sense and understanding?" "I must, sir," I said, "ask you of all things, because I am wholly unable to understand them; for all these things are great and glorious, and difficult for man to understand".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 38:7
verses.text: "Listen," he said: "the name of the Son of God is great, and cannot be contained, and supports the whole world.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 38:8
verses.text: If, then, the whole creation is supported by the  Son of God, what think ye of those who are called by Him, and bear the name of the Son of God, and walk in His commandments? do you see what kind of persons He supports? Those who bear His name with their whole heart.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 38:9
verses.text: He Himself, accordingly, became a foundation to them, and supports them with joy, because they are not ashamed to bear His name".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 39:1
verses.text: Chapter - 15  "Explain to me, sir," I said, "the names of these virgins, and of those women who were clothed in black raiment".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 39:2
verses.text: "Hear," he said, "the names of the stronger virgins who stood at the corners.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 39:3
verses.text: The first is Faith, the second Continence, the third Power, the fourth Patience.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 39:4
verses.text: And the others standing in the midst of these have the following names: Simplicity, Innocence, Purity, Cheerfulness, Truth, Understanding, Harmony, Love.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 39:5
verses.text: He who bears these names and that of the Son of God will be able to enter into the kingdom of God.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 39:6
verses.text: Hear, also," he continued, "the names of the women who had the black garments; and of these four are stronger than the rest.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 39:7
verses.text: The first is Unbelief, the second: Incontinence, the third Disobedience, the fourth Deceit.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 39:8
verses.text: And their followers are called Sorrow, Wickedness, Wantonness, Anger, Falsehood, Folly, Backbiting, Hatred.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 39:9
verses.text: The servant of God who bears these names shall see, indeed, the kingdom of God, but shall not enter into it".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 39:10
verses.text: "And the stones, sir," I said, "which were taken out of the pit and fitted into the building: what are they?" "The first," he said, "the ten, viz.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 39:11
verses.text: , that were placed as a foundation, are the first generation, and the twenty-five the second generation, of righteous men; and the thirty-five are the prophets of God and His ministers; and the forty are the apostles and teachers of the preaching of the Son of God".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 39:12
verses.text: "Why, then, sir," I asked, "did the virgins carry these stones also through the gate, and give them for the building of the tower?" "Because," he answered, "these were the first who bore these spirits, and they never departed from each other, neither the spirits from the men nor the men from the spirits, but the spirits remained with them until their falling asleep.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 39:13
verses.text: And unless they had had these spirits with them, they would not have been of use for the building of this tower".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 40:1
verses.text: Chapter - 16  "Explain to me a little further, sir," I said.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 40:2
verses.text: "What is it that you desire?" he asked.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 40:3
verses.text: "Why, sir," I said, "did these stones ascend out of the pit, and be applied to the building of the tower, after having borne these spirits?" "They were obliged," he answered, "to ascend through water in order that they might be made alive; for, unless they laid aside the deadness of their life, they could not in any other way enter into the kingdom of God.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 40:4
verses.text: Accordingly, those also who fell asleep received the seal of the Son of God.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 40:5
verses.text: For," he continued, "before a man bears the name of the Son of God he is dead; but when he receives the seal he lays aside his deadness, and obtains life.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 40:6
verses.text: The seal, then, is the water: they descend into the water dead, and they arise alive.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 40:7
verses.text: And to them, accordingly, was this seal preached, and they made use of it that they might enter into the kingdom of God".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 40:8
verses.text: "Why, sir," I asked, "did the forty stones also ascend with them out of the pit, having already received the seal?" "Because," he said, "these apostles and teachers who preached the name of the Son of God, after falling asleep in the power and faith of the Son of God, preached it not only to those who were asleep, but themselves also gave them the seal of the preaching.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 40:9
verses.text: Accordingly they descended with them into the water, and again ascended.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 40:10
verses.text: But these descended alive and rose up again alive; whereas they who had previously fallen asleep descended dead, but rose up again alive.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 40:11
verses.text: By these, then, were they quickened and made to know the name of the Son of God.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 40:12
verses.text: For this reason also did they ascend with them, and were fitted along with them into the building of the tower, and, untouched by the chisel, were built in along with them.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 40:13
verses.text: For they slept in righteousness and in great purity, but only they had not this seal.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 40:14
verses.text: You have accordingly the explanation of these also".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 41:1
verses.text: Chapter - 17  "I understand, sir," I replied.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 41:2
verses.text: "Now, sir," I continued, "explain to me, with respect to the mountains, why their forms are various and diverse".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 41:3
verses.text: "Listen," he said: "these mountains are the twelve tribes, which inhabit the whole world.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 41:4
verses.text: The Son of God, accordingly, was preached unto them by the apostles".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 41:5
verses.text: "But why are the mountains of various kinds, some having one form, and others another? Explain that to me, sir".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 41:6
verses.text: "Listen," he answered: "these twelve tribes that inhabit the whole world are twelve nations.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 41:7
verses.text: And they vary in prudence and understanding.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 41:8
verses.text: As numerous, then, as are the varieties of the mountains which you saw,  are also the diversities of mind and understanding among these nations.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 41:9
verses.text: And I will explain to you the actions of each one".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 41:10
verses.text: "First, sir," I said, "explain this: why, when the mountains are so diverse, their stones, when placed in the building, became one colour, shining like those also that had ascended out of the pit".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 41:11
verses.text: "Because," he said, "all the nations that dwell under heaven were called by hearing and believing upon the name of the Son of God.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 41:12
verses.text: Having, therefore, received the seal, they had one understanding and one mind; and their faith became one, and their love one, and with the name they bore also the spirits of the virgins.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 41:13
verses.text: On this account the building of the tower became of one colour, bright as the sun.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 41:14
verses.text: But after they had entered into the same place, and became one body, certain of these defiled themselves, and were expelled from the race of the righteous, and became again what they were before, or rather worse".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 42:1
verses.text: Chapter - 18  "How, sir," I said, "did they become worse, after having known God?" "He that does not know God," he answered, "and practices evil, receives a certain chastisement for his wickedness; but he that has known God, ought not any longer to do evil, but to do good.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 42:2
verses.text: If, accordingly, when he ought to do good, he do evil, does not he appear to do greater evil than he who does not know God? For this reason, they who have not known God and do evil are condemned to death; but they who have known God, and have seen His mighty works, and still continue in evil, shall be chastised doubly, and shall die for ever.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 42:3
verses.text: In this way, then, will the Church of God be purified.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 42:4
verses.text: For as you saw the stones rejected from the tower, and delivered to the evil spirits, and cast out thence, so they also shall be cast out, and there shall be one body of the purified; as the tower also became, as it were, of one stone after its purification.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 42:5
verses.text: In like manner also shall it be with the Church of God, after it has been purified, and has rejected the wicked, and the hypocrites, and the blasphemers, and the waverers, and those who commit wickedness of different kinds.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 42:6
verses.text: After these have been cast away, the Church of God shall be one body, of one mind, of one understanding, of one faith, of one love.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 42:7
verses.text: And then the Son of God will be exceeding glad, and shall rejoice over them, because He has received His people pure".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 42:8
verses.text: "All these things, sir," I said, "are great and glorious".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 42:9
verses.text: "Moreover, sir," I said, "explain to me the power and the actions of each one of the mountains, that every soul, trusting in the Lord, and hearing it, may glorify His great, and marvellous, and glorious name".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 42:10
verses.text: "Hear," he said, "the diversity of the mountains and of the twelve nations".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 43:1
verses.text: Chapter - 19  "From the first mountain, which was black, they that believed are the following: apostates and blasphemers against the Lord, and betrayers of the servants of God.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 43:2
verses.text: To these repentance is not open; but death lies before them, and on this account also are they black, for their race is a lawless one.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 43:3
verses.text: And from the second mountain, which was bare, they who believed are the following: hypocrites, and teachers of wickedness.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 43:4
verses.text: And these, accordingly, are like the former, not having any fruits of righteousness; for as their mountain was destitute of fruit, so also such men have a name indeed, but are empty of faith, and there is no fruit of truth in them.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 43:5
verses.text: They indeed have repentance in their power, if they repent quickly; but if they are slow in so doing, they shall die along with the former".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 43:6
verses.text: "Why, sir," I said, "have these repentance, but the former not? for their actions are nearly the same".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 43:7
verses.text: "On this account," he said, "have these repentance, because they did not blaspheme their Lord, nor become betrayers of the servants of God; but on account of their desire of possessions they became hypocritical, and each one taught according to the desires of men that were sinners.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 43:8
verses.text: But they will suffer a certain punishment; and repentance is before them, because they were not blasphemers or traitors".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 44:1
verses.text: Chapter - 20  "And from the third mountain, which had thorns and thistles, they who believed are the following.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 44:2
verses.text: There are some of them rich, and others immersed in much business.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 44:3
verses.text: The thistles are the rich, and the thorns are they who are immersed in much business.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 44:4
verses.text: Those, accordingly, who are entangled in many various kinds of business, do not cleave to the servants of God, but wander away, being choked by their business transactions; and the rich cleave with difficulty to the servants of God, fearing lest these should ask something of them.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 44:5
verses.text: Such persons, accordingly, shall have difficulty in entering the kingdom of God.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 44:6
verses.text: For as it is disagreeable to walk among thistles with naked feet, so also it is hard for such to enter the kingdom of God.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 44:7
verses.text: But to all these repentance, and that speedy, is open, in order that what they did not do in former  times they may make up for in these days, and do some good, and they shall live unto God.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 44:8
verses.text: But if they abide in their deeds, they shall be delivered to those women, who will put them to death".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 45:1
verses.text: Chapter - 21  "And from the fourth mountain, which had much grass, the upper parts of the plants green, and the parts about the roots withered, and some also scorched by the sun, they who believed are the following: the doubtful, and they who have the Lord upon their lips, but have Him not in their heart.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 45:2
verses.text: On this account their foundations are withered, and have no strength; and their words alone live, while their works are dead.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 45:3
verses.text: Such persons are neither alive nor dead.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 45:4
verses.text: They resemble, therefore, the waverers: for the wavering are neither withered nor green, being neither living nor dead.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 45:5
verses.text: For as their blades, on seeing the sun, were withered, so also the wavering, when they hear of affliction, on account of their fear, worship idols, and are ashamed of the name of their Lord.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 45:6
verses.text: Such, then, are neither alive nor dead.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 45:7
verses.text: But these also may yet live, if they repent quickly; and if they do not repent, they are already delivered to the women, who take away their life".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 46:1
verses.text: Chapter - 22  "And from the fifth mountain, which had green grass, and was rugged, they who believed are the following: believers, indeed, but slow to learn, and obstinate, and pleasing themselves, wishing to know everything, and knowing nothing at all.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 46:2
verses.text: On account of this obstinacy of theirs, understanding departed from them, and foolish senselessness entered into them.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 46:3
verses.text: And they praise themselves as having wisdom, and desire to become teachers, although destitute of sense.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 46:4
verses.text: On account, therefore, of this loftiness of mind, many became vain, exalting themselves: for self-will and empty confidence is a great demon.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 46:5
verses.text: Of these, accordingly, many were rejected, but some repented and believed, and subjected themselves to those that had understanding, knowing their own foolishness.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 46:6
verses.text: And to the rest of this class repentance is open; for they were not wicked, but rather foolish, and without understanding.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 46:7
verses.text: If these therefore repent, they will live unto God; but if they do not repent, they shall have their dwelling with the women who wrought wickedness among them".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 47:1
verses.text: Chapter - 23  "And those from the sixth mountain, which had clefts large and small, and decayed grass in the clefts, who believed, were the following: they who occupy the small clefts are those who bring charges against one another, and by reason of their slanders have decayed in the faith.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 47:2
verses.text: Many of them, however, repented; and the rest also will repent when they hear my commandments, for their slanders are small, and they will quickly repent.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 47:3
verses.text: But they who occupy the large clefts are persistent in their slanders, and vindictive in their anger against each other.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 47:4
verses.text: These, therefore, were thrown away from the tower, and rejected from having a part in its building.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 47:5
verses.text: Such persons, accordingly, shall have difficulty in living.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 47:6
verses.text: If our God and Lord, who rules over all things, and has power over all His creation, does not remember evil against those who confess their sins, but is merciful, does man, who is corruptible and full of sins, remember evil against a fellow-man, as if he were able to destroy or to save him? I, the angel of repentance, say unto you, As many of you as are of this way of thinking, lay it aside, and repent, and the Lord will heal your former sins, if you purify yourselves from this demon; but if not, you will be delivered over to him for death".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 48:1
verses.text: Chapter - 24  "And those who believed from the seventh mountain, on which the grass was green and flourishing, and the whole of the mountain fertile, and every kind of cattle and the fowls of heaven were feeding on the grass on this mountain, and the grass on which they pastured became more abundant, were the following: they were always simple, and harmless, and blessed, bringing no charges against one another, but always rejoicing greatly because of the servants of God, and being clothed with the holy spirit of these virgins, and always having pity on every man, and giving aid from their own labour to every man, without reproach and without hesitation.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 48:2
verses.text: The Lord, therefore, seeing their simplicity and all their meekness, multiplied them amid the labours of their hands, and gave them grace in all their doings.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 48:3
verses.text: And I, the angel of repentance, say to you who are such, Continue to be such as these, and your seed will never be blotted out; for the Lord has made trial of you, and inscribed you in the number of us, and the whole of your seed will dwell with the Son of God; for ye have received of His Spirit".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 49:1
verses.text: Chapter - 25  "And they who believed from the eighth mountain, where were the many fountains, and where all the creatures of God drank of the fountains, were the following: apostles, and teachers, who preached to the whole world, and who taught solemnly and purely the word of the Lord, and  did not at all fall into evil desires, but walked always in righteousness and truth, according as they had received the Holy Spirit.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 49:2
verses.text: Such persons, therefore, shall enter in with the angels".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 50:1
verses.text: Chapter - 26  "And they who believed from the ninth mountain, which was deserted, and had in it creeping things and wild beasts which destroy men, were the following: they who had the stains as servants, who discharged their duty ill, and who plundered widows and orphans of their livelihood, and gained possessions for themselves from the ministry, which they had received.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 50:2
verses.text: If, therefore, they remain under the dominion of the same desire, they are dead, and there is no hope of life for them; but if they repent, and finish their ministry in a holy manner, they shall be able to live.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 50:3
verses.text: And they who were covered with scabs are those who have denied their Lord, and have not returned to Him again; but becoming withered and desert-like, and not cleaving to the servants of God, but living in solitude, they destroy their own souls.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 50:4
verses.text: For as a vine, when left within an enclosure, and meeting with neglect, is destroyed, and is made desolate by the weeds, and in time grows wild, and is no longer of any use to its master, so also are such men as have given themselves up, and become useless to their Lord, from having contracted savage habits.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 50:5
verses.text: These men, therefore, have repentance in their power, unless they are found to have denied from the heart; but if any one is found to have denied from the heart, I do not know if he may live.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 50:6
verses.text: And I say this not for these present days, in order that any one who has denied may obtain repentance, for it is impossible for him to be saved who now intends to deny his Lord; but to those who denied Him long ago, repentance seems to be possible.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 50:7
verses.text: If, therefore, any one intends to repent, let him do so quickly, before the tower is completed; for if not, he will be utterly destroyed by the women.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 50:8
verses.text: And the chipped stones are the deceitful and the slanderers; and the wild beasts which you saw on the ninth mountain, are the same.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 50:9
verses.text: For as wild beasts destroy and kill a man by their poison, so also do the words of such men destroy and ruin a man.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 50:10
verses.text: These, accordingly, are mutilated in their faith, on account of the deeds which they have done in themselves; yet some repented, and were saved.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 50:11
verses.text: And the rest, who are of such a character, can be saved if they repent; but if they do not repent, they will perish with those women, whose strength they have assumed".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 51:1
verses.text: Chapter - 27  "And from the tenth mountain, where were trees which overshadowed certain sheep, they who believed were the following: bishops given to hospitality, who always gladly received into their houses the servants of God, without dissimulation.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 51:2
verses.text: And the bishops never failed to protect, by their service, the widows, and those who were in want, and always maintained a holy conversation.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 51:3
verses.text: All these, accordingly, shall be protected by the Lord for ever.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 51:4
verses.text: They who do these things are honourable before God, and their place is already with the angels, if they remain to the end serving God".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 52:1
verses.text: Chapter - 28  "And from the eleventh mountain, where were trees full of fruits, adorned with fruits of various kinds, they who believed were the following: they who suffered for the name of the Son of God, and who also suffered cheerfully with their whole heart, and laid down their lives".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 52:2
verses.text: "Why, then, sir," I said, "do all these trees bear fruit, and some of them fairer than the rest?" "Listen," he said: "all who once suffered for the name of the Lord are honourable before God; and of all these the sins were remitted, because they suffered for the name of the Son of God.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 52:3
verses.text: And why their fruits are of various kinds, and some of them superior, listen.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 52:4
verses.text: All," he continued, "who were brought before the authorities and were examined, and did not deny, but suffered cheerfully—these are held in greater honour with God, and of these the fruit is superior; but all who were cowards, and in doubt, and who reasoned in their hearts whether they would deny or confess, and yet suffered, of these the fruit is less, because that suggestion came into their hearts; for that suggestion—that a servant should deny his Lord—is evil.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 52:5
verses.text: Have a care, therefore, ye who are planning such things, lest that suggestion remain in your hearts, and  ye perish unto God.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 52:6
verses.text: And ye who suffer for His name ought to glorify God, because He deemed you worthy to bear His name, that all your sins might be healed.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 52:7
verses.text: Therefore, rather deem yourselves happy, and think that ye have done a great thing, if any of you suffer on account of God.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 52:8
verses.text: The Lord bestows upon you life, and ye do not understand, for your sins were heavy; but if you had not suffered for the name of the Lord, ye would have died to God on account of your sins.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 52:9
verses.text: These things I say to you who are hesitating about denying or confessing: acknowledge that ye have the Lord, lest, denying Him, ye be delivered up to prison.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 52:10
verses.text: If the heathen chastise their slaves, when one of them denies his master, what, think ye, will your Lord do, who has authority over all men? Put away these counsels out of your hearts, that you may live continually unto God".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 53:1
verses.text: Chapter - 29  "And they who believed from the twelfth mountain, which was white, are the following: they are as infant children, in whose hearts no evil originates; nor did they know what wickedness is, but always remained as children.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 53:2
verses.text: Such accordingly, without doubt, dwell in the kingdom of God, because they defiled in nothing the commandments of God; but they remained like children all the days of their life in the same mind.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 53:3
verses.text: All of you, then, who shall remain stedfast, and be as children, without doing evil, will be more honoured than all who have been previously mentioned; for all infants are honourable before God, and are the first persons with Him.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 53:4
verses.text: Blessed, then, are ye who put away wickedness from yourselves, and put on innocence.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 53:5
verses.text: As the first of all will you live unto God".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 53:6
verses.text: After he had finished the similitudes of the mountains, I said to him, "Sir, explain to me now about the stones that were taken out of the plain, and put into the building instead of the stones that were taken out of the tower; and about the round stones that were put into the building; and those that still remain round".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 54:1
verses.text: Chapter - 30  "Hear," he answered, "about all these also.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 54:2
verses.text: The stones taken out of the plain and put into the building of the tower instead of those that were rejected, are the roots of this white mountain.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 54:3
verses.text: When, therefore, they who believed from the white mountain were all found guileless, the Lord of the tower commanded those from the roots of this mountain to be cast into the building of the tower; for he knew that if these stones were to go to the building of the tower, they would remain bright, and not one of them become black.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 54:4
verses.text: But if he had so resolved with respect to the other mountains, it would have been necessary for him to visit that tower again, and to cleanse it.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 54:5
verses.text: Now all these persons were found white who believed, and who will yet believe, for they are of the same race.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 54:6
verses.text: This is a happy race, because it is innocent.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 54:7
verses.text: Hear now, further, about these round and shining stones.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 54:8
verses.text: All these also are from the white mountain.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 54:9
verses.text: Hear, moreover, why they were found round: because their riches had obscured and darkened them a little from the truth, although they never departed from God; nor did any evil word proceed out of their mouth, but all justice, virtue, and truth.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 54:10
verses.text: When the Lord, therefore, saw the mind of these persons, that they were born good, and could be good, He ordered their riches to be cut down, not to be taken away for ever, that they might be able to do some good with what was left them; and they will live unto God, because they are of a good race.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 54:11
verses.text: Therefore were they rounded a little by the chisel, and put in the building of the tower.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 55:1
verses.text: Chapter - 31  "But the other round stones, which had not yet been adapted to the building of the tower, and had not yet received the seal, were for this reason put back into their place, because they are exceedingly round.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 55:2
verses.text: Now this age must be cut down in these things, and in the vanities of their riches, and then they will meet in the kingdom of God; for they must of necessity enter into the kingdom of God, because the Lord has blessed this innocent race.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 55:3
verses.text: Of this race, therefore, no one will perish; for although any of them be tempted by the most wicked devil, and commit sin, he will quickly return to his Lord.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 55:4
verses.text: I deem you happy, I, who am the messenger of repentance, whoever of you are innocent as children, because your part is good, and honourable before God.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 55:5
verses.text: Moreover, I say to you all, who have received the seal of the Son of God, be clothed with simplicity, and be not mindful of offences, nor remain in wickedness.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 55:6
verses.text: Lay aside, therefore, the recollection of your offences and bitternesses, and you will be formed in one spirit.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 55:7
verses.text: And heal and take away from you those wicked schisms, that if the Lord of the flocks come, He may rejoice concerning you.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 55:8
verses.text: And He will rejoice, if He find all things sound, and none of you shall perish.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 55:9
verses.text: But if He find any one of these sheep strayed, woe to the shepherds! And if the shepherds themselves have  strayed, what answer will they give Him for their flocks? Will they perchance say that they were harassed by their flocks? They will not be believed, for the thing is incredible that a shepherd could suffer from his flock; rather will he be punished on account of his falsehood.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 55:10
verses.text: And I myself am a shepherd, and I am under a most stringent necessity of rendering an account of you.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 56:1
verses.text: Chapter - 32  "Heal yourselves, therefore, while the tower is still building.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 56:2
verses.text: The Lord dwells in men that love peace, because He loved peace; but from the contentious and the utterly wicked He is far distant.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 56:3
verses.text: Restore to Him, therefore, a spirit sound as ye received it.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 56:4
verses.text: For when you have given to a fuller a new garment, and desire to receive it back entire at the end, if, then, the fuller return you a torn garment, will you take it from him, and not rather be angry, and abuse him, saying, 'I gave you a garment that was entire: why have you rent it, and made it useless, so that it can be of no use on account of the rent which you have made in it?' Would you not say all this to the fuller about the rent which you found in your garment? If, therefore, you grieve about your garment, and complain because you have not received it entire, what do you think the Lord will do to you, who gave you a sound spirit, which you have rendered altogether useless, so that it can be of no service to its possessor? for its use began to be unprofitable, seeing it was corrupted by you.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 56:5
verses.text: Will not the Lord, therefore, because of this conduct of yours regarding His Spirit, act in the same way, and deliver you over to death? Assuredly, I say, he will do the same to all those whom He shall find retaining a recollection of offences.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 56:6
verses.text: Do not trample His mercy under foot, He says, but rather honour Him, because He is so patient with your sins, and is not as ye are.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 56:7
verses.text: Repent, for it is useful to you".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 57:1
verses.text: Chapter - 33  "All these things which are written above, I, the Shepherd, the messenger of repentance, have showed and spoken to the servants of God.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 57:2
verses.text: If therefore ye believe, and listen to my words, and walk in them, and amend your ways, you shall have it in your power to live: but if you remain in wickedness, and in the recollection of offences, no sinner of that class will live unto God.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 57:3
verses.text: All these words which I had to say have been spoken unto you".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 57:4
verses.text: The Shepherd said to me, "Have you asked me everything?" And I replied, "Yes, sir".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 57:5
verses.text: "Why did you not ask me about the shape of the stones that were put into the building, that I might explain to you why we filled up the shapes?" And I said, "I forgot, sir".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 57:6
verses.text: "Hear now, then," he said, "about this also.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 57:7
verses.text: These are they who have now heard my commandments, and repented with their whole hearts.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 57:8
verses.text: And when the Lord saw that their repentance was good and pure, and that they were able to remain in it, He ordered their former sins to be blotted out.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 57:9
verses.text: For these shapes were their sins, and they were levelled down, that they might not appear".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 57:10
verses.text: Similitude Tenth.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 57:11
verses.text: Concerning Repentance and Alms-Giving.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 58:1
verses.text: Chapter - 1  After I had fully written down this book, that messenger who had delivered me to the Shepherd came into the house in which I was, and sat down upon a couch, and the Shepherd stood on his right hand.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 58:2
verses.text: He then called me, and spoke to me as follows: "I have delivered you and your house to the Shepherd, that you may be protected by him".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 58:3
verses.text: "Yes, sir," I said.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 58:4
verses.text: "If you wish, therefore, to be protected," he said, "from all annoyance, and from all harsh treatment, and to have success in every good work and word, and to possess all the virtues of righteousness, walk in these commandments which he has given you, and you will be able to subdue all wickedness.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 58:5
verses.text: For if you keep those commandments, every desire and pleasure of the world will be subject to you, and success will attend you in every good work.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 58:6
verses.text: Take unto yourself his experience and moderation, and say to all that he is in great honour and dignity with God, and that he is a president with great power, and mighty in his office.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 58:7
verses.text: To him alone throughout the whole world is the power of repentance assigned.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 58:8
verses.text: Does he seem to you to be powerful? But you despise his experience, and the moderation which he exercises towards you".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 59:1
verses.text: Chapter - 2  I said to him, "Ask himself, sir, whether from the time that he has entered my house I have done anything improper, or have offended him in any respect".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 59:2
verses.text: He answered, "I also know that you neither have done nor will do anything improper, and therefore I speak these words to you, that you may persevere.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 59:3
verses.text: For he had a good report of you to me, and you will say these words to others, that they also who have either repented or will still repent may entertain the same feelings with you, and he may report well of these to me, and I to the Lord".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 59:4
verses.text: And I  said, "Sir, I make known to every man the great works of God: and I hope that all those who love them, and have sinned before, on hearing these words, may repent, and receive life again".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 59:5
verses.text: "Continue, therefore, in this ministry, and finish it.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 59:6
verses.text: And all who follow out his commands shall have life, and great honour with the Lord.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 59:7
verses.text: But those who do not keep his commandments, flee from his life, and despise him.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 59:8
verses.text: But he has his own honour with the Lord.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 59:9
verses.text: All, therefore, who shall despise him, and not follow his commands, deliver themselves to death, and every one of them will be guilty of his own blood.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 59:10
verses.text: But I enjoin you, that you obey his commands, and you will have a cure for your former sins".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 60:1
verses.text: Chapter - 3  "Moreover, I sent you these virgins, that they may dwell with you.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 60:2
verses.text: For I saw that they were courteous to you.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 60:3
verses.text: You will therefore have them as assistants, that you may be the better able to keep his commands: for it is impossible that these commandments can be observed without these virgins.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 60:4
verses.text: I see, moreover, that they abide with you willingly; but I will also instruct them not to depart at all from your house: do you only keep your house pure, as they will delight to dwell in a pure abode.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 60:5
verses.text: For they are pure, and chaste, and industrious, and have all influence with the Lord.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 60:6
verses.text: Therefore, if they find your house to be pure, they will remain with you; but if any defilement, even a little, befall it, they will immediately withdraw from your house.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 60:7
verses.text: For these virgins do not at all like any defilement".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 60:8
verses.text: I said to him, "I hope, sir, that I will please them, so that they may always be willing to inhabit my house.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 60:9
verses.text: And as he to whom you entrusted me has no complaint against me, so neither will they have".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 60:10
verses.text: He said to the Shepherd, "I see that the servant of God wishes to live, and to keep these commandments, and will place these virgins in a pure habitation".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 60:11
verses.text: When he had spoken these words he again delivered me to the Shepherd, and called those virgins, and said to them, "Since I see that you are willing to dwell in his house, I commend him and his house to you, asking that you withdraw not at all from it".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 60:12
verses.text: And the virgins heard these words with pleasure.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 61:1
verses.text: Chapter - 4  The angel then said to me, "Conduct yourself manfully in this service, and make known to every one the great things of God, and you will have favour in this ministry.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 61:2
verses.text: Whoever, therefore, shall walk in these commandments, shall have life, and will be happy in his life; but whosoever shall neglect them shall not have life, and will be unhappy in this life.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 61:3
verses.text: Enjoin all, who are able to act rightly, not to cease well-doing; for, to practice good works is useful to them.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 61:4
verses.text: And I say that every man ought to be saved from inconveniences.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 61:5
verses.text: For both he who is in want, and he who suffers inconveniences in his daily life, is in great torture and necessity.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 61:6
verses.text: Whoever, therefore, rescues a soul of this kind from necessity, will gain for himself great joy.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 61:7
verses.text: For he who is harassed by inconveniences of this kind, suffers equal torture with him who is in chains.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 61:8
verses.text: Moreover many, on account of calamities of this sort, when they could not endure them, hasten their own deaths.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 61:9
verses.text: Whoever, then, knows a calamity of this kind afflicting a man, and does not save him, commits a great sin, and becomes guilty of his blood.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 61:10
verses.text: Do good works, therefore, ye who have received good from the Lord; lest, while ye delay to do them, the building of the tower be finished, and you be rejected from the edifice: there is now no other tower a-building.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 61:11
verses.text: For on your account was the work of building suspended.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 61:12
verses.text: Unless, then, you make haste to do rightly, the tower will be completed, and you will be excluded".

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 61:13
verses.text: After he had spoken with me he rose up from the couch, and taking the Shepherd and the virgins, he departed.

verses.name: Hermas: Book III 61:14
verses.text: But he said to me that he would send back the Shepherd and the virgins to my dwelling, Amen.
